Reviews.Title: “Sunday Brunch needs some work”
Reviews.Author: dlarocqu
Reviews.Content: 3 of us went for brunch and it was quite the debacle. We had to ask numerous times to different people for regular items like napkins and knives. My friend ordered decaf coffee which never appeared until we repeatedly asked. Juice that came with our breakfast also wouldn't have shown up except for our asking several folks and the excuse initially is sorry we are busy. Hmmmm, aren't you always busy for brunch and should be prepared? One of the waiters that seems more senior and a bit mortified by our experience said it was mostly new staff. The breakfast itself was just kind of normal. I would go again for the view and hope they train the staff better.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds & great pillows, loved the service”
Reviews.Author: Ris B
Reviews.Content: Great location with comfortable accommodation and welcoming staff. Lovely views from restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Florence57
Reviews.Content: If you want everything bright and shiny, this may not be the place for you. But if you appreciate a patina of age, combined with homey comfort, you are sure love the Sylvia Hotel. On our most recent visit, we were given a corner room on the seventh floor, overlooking the busy come-and-go of pedestrians, bikes and cars along the shore of English Bay, yet far enough up for a long view and plenty of quiet. Special pleasures: breakfast in windowed nook in the dining room, re-reading Lois Simmie's Mr. Go-to-Go books in the lobby, and the short walk to see the herons on the edge of Stanley Park. For us, Vancouver wouldn't be Vancouver without the Sylvia

Reviews.Title: “A California Kid at the Sylvia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCBackyard
Reviews.Content: For a fleeting moment, just before making reservations at the Sylvia for myself and my niece from Santa Cruz, Ca. I wondered if she might find the Vancouver landmark either too urban [lots of traffic, ditto people] or insufficiently posh [what, no boutiques?]. Built in 1912 and nestled into the West End, the Sylvia resembles a small, European hotel in, say, San Sebastian. It has been updated from time to time but will never achieve the efficiency of a modern chain hotel --- if that is what one is looking for. As for my niece, she was won over by the view of English Bay from our room and by the hotel's location: cross the street and you're on the beach; a little further on, and you're in Stanley Park; nearby Denman Street has great restaurants and markets. Our room appeared to have been recently painted and refurnished: the beds were extremely comfortable; the linens, first rate. On the less positive side, the bathroom lacked a fan, and there was a sharp step down from the bathroom to the sleeping area -- a night light or even some reflective tape would have been helpful. The hotel was also having problems with the Wi-Fi connection in the guest rooms while we were there. The computer in the lobby, which seemed to be more dependable, was also available for guest use. One note: if you're concerned about the layout or size of the room you've reserved, ask if you can see it before signing in. The staff will generally find something more appropriate to your needs if they have vacancies.

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: Brenda S
Reviews.Content: Returned for another weekend getaway, this time bringing friends. Once again, enjoyed our stayed. Lovely room with view of English Bay. Considering that this is a perfect ocean location, the hotel does not overcharge, for the rooms or the food & beverage. Brunch was wonderful. We were extremely lucky to have the same waiter we did when we stayed in Oct...Izad was once again very attentive, funny and it was a pleasure seeing him again. Our friends really enjoyed the morning with him as our server. Special thank you to Rick for my birthday upgrade and for taking care of our reservations and answering all our questions. See you again soon. Maybe this time with our boys to watch the fireworks in the summer. thanks again. two couples from the subhurbs.

Reviews.Title: “The Sylvia”
Reviews.Author: marivietnam
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Sylvia with so much going on in the neighborhood we were never at a loss for something to do or see. The restaraunts were plentiful and good, the sea wall was a bustls of activity and the sun was out ... made for many smiley faces. I have wanted to stay here since I was a young girl and it was apartments at that time ... what a wonderful retreat within the city. Our suite was clean spacious and massive with views of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JANETH154914
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver for two days March 18 and 19. The staff was more then helpful. They gave us the most beautiful room with a view to English Bay.The location is the best in Vancouver. We enjoyed brunch in there restaurant looking out at English bay. We loved everything about this Hotel, and hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “such a classic!”
Reviews.Author: annitimble
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 5pm. Check in was a breeze! My room was small ,with a great view. Staying at the Sylvia is really like a grab bag, with no bad grabs!!! After leaving my bag in the room, went to the "cocktail lounge". It was the first one in Vancouver many years ago. They serve yummy cocktails, all with an amazing view of English Bay. This is a classic lounge. No noisy music or TV's. Thank goodness. It is, literally, right across the street. A nice long stretch of sandy beach, and lovely beach walk which will take you all around Stanely Park if you so choose. The food was fine, nothing out of the ordinary, which is a shame, but not expected. Service was great for breakfast too. Bed was very comfy, and the room quiet. This was my second stay,even better than the first.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place full of turn of the Century Charm”
Reviews.Author: pcorsano
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built before WWI and has the perfect location overlooking English Bay. In a city that is hyper modern, it is so great to have this landmark piece of architecture survive. The dining room and bar have the perfect view over English Bay and the ships at anchor in its Roads. The Edwardian Charm still there. I loved this Hotel and even though less grand than the Big Hotel's of Vancouver, it is definitely the most charming and very reasonably priced. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “You want to like it....”
Reviews.Author: parrot101
Reviews.Content: It is perfectly located by the park and right on the beach. The view is stunning and it is close to downtown by not downtown... so perfect. From the front door to the water is literally 50 yards. But the place is a ... dump. Terribly unkind but true. The staff are nice and breakfast fine. The rooms are roomy. But everything needs updating. From the doors, to the ceiling to the walls. I think it is mostly clean but it is so old and cracked and ill-fitted that you you never really feel that it is clean. In a perfect world someone would turn it into the ultra trendy hotel with a 80 million dollar reno. I wish I liked it more.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Tod A
Reviews.Content: Generally I would stay at the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver but due to a sold out night I was required to make alternative arrangements and until I stumbled upon the Sylvia I was at about 549/night that was available. I did know about the Sylvia but thought it was a boutique compared to a Heritage Hotel and expected it to be quite pricey. To my surprise it was very reasonable below 125/night in downtown Vancouver or more specifically right at English Bay just off Denman. Beautiful location with stunning views from the pub/restaurant. I didn't have a bayside room but the corner room I did stay in was very large with a small private bedroom and 2 queen beds in main room, it was rustic (not sure about the safety of the doorlock system)but very well kept. Really good live music Thursday nights, I think it is a must try.

Reviews.Title: “A glimpse of the past on English Bay”
Reviews.Author: NPassant
Reviews.Content: Hotel dates back to an apartment block of the early 1900s and has an old-fashioned feel, but not in a bad way. Our room, facing towards the sea, was decidedly chilly on arrival as the windows had been left open to air out the room, but the room was very spacious with good facilities. Details such as light fixtures need attention as the hotel's refurbishment continues, but the hotel is a good choice for a short, economical stay in Vancouver -- close to downtown, and at the beginning of a glorious walk (on a fine day) around Stanley Park. Good breakfast in attached restaurant, but real maple syrup a necessity -- not available, but should be, even if at a slight additional cost!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful get-away”
Reviews.Author: thetravelbug49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sylvia Hotel for a 4 night get-away with friends. We had a suite with access to an adjoining bedroom and bathroom, which was absolutely perfect for 2 couples. The view of English Bay and location can't be beat. We enjoyed the many restaurants in the area and access to the sea wall and walking the beach. It has the feel of a more residential neighbourhood than being downtown in a big city, yet is close to everything you could want. The restaurant is quaint and affordable with amazing views of the ocean. Loved it and will definitely be back. Staff were very accommodating and friendly. It is not a modern hotel and if you look closely you can see signs of its age. The elevator is small and slow, but the history and mood of the hotel far outweighs these small inconveniences. I would highly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway for couples and friends.

Reviews.Title: “The view and location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonjunkie
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia Hotel dates back to at least 1913 and not allot of changes have taken place to destroy the original charm of this hotel. It is situated on the corner of Gilford and Beach and right across the street from English Bay. If you are looking for ultra modern do not go to the Sylvia but if you want the experience of feeling like you have stepped back into the past, a quieter and little more classic time, then head for the Sylvia. We have stayed here a number of times and while we enjoy it every time...we always ask for beach view. our favorite stay was one night of the Symphony of Fire. This is an international competition of fireworks display over English Bay and with a beach front view one can enjoy the show from your room! The lobby and staff are all cheerful and helpful. I love this place! And so does my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and warm gem on English Bay!!”
Reviews.Author: Basil S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 5 or 6 times over the past 5 years. You simply cannot beat the location and charm of this hotel. The staff are exceptionally helpful and genuinely friendly. The Sylvia is my first choice whenever I go to Vancouver, and its location is probably my favorite place in Canada. I feel like I'm at home at the Sylvia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel in amazing location”
Reviews.Author: CarenP39
Reviews.Content: Loved the ambiance of this classic old hotel. We had breakfast twice in the lovely restaurant and the second time we were in a hurry. The waitress was excellent and made sure we got our food with time to spare. The location could not be better with lots of tourist attractions and great shopping right there. Beds were very comfortable. Rooms were very clean. The only complaint that I have is that when I booked our room I was assured that we were getting a room with a view of the bay. When we checked in, we were told that we had been upgraded...nice. But unfortunately we had been upgraded to a non view room that had a kitchen, which we didn't need. When I asked about this, I was told that the hotel was booked solid now and there was nothing they could do. Unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: fromcanada51
Reviews.Content: I love the Sylvia. I visited Vancouver during a rainy week, but I didn't care because my stay at the Sylvia was so cosy and warm. With a beautiful view of English Bay, the cosy room I was in felt like it was made for me. (I hope I can stay in it again when I come back to Vancouver for another visit). The service at the hotel is friendly and efficient. If you appreciate the character of an older hotel, the Sylvia can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Janet B
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the staff who make our every stay at The Sylvia a memorable one - from the front desk to the restaurant. From the valley we drive in to Vancouver always anticipating the delightful location and the unique character of this old hotel and we are never disappointed. This time we were in the newer part of the hotel and found the bed very comfortable and all the amenities to make for a wonderful stay. Thank you! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: GreenLakeReener
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many of the top rated Vancouver hotels in Coal Harbour and the downtown core, but for this trip we decided to try out the older Slyvia Hotel located right across from English Bay at the entrance to Stanley Park. We were upgraded to a suite overlooking English Bay on the 7th floor and were very pleased with our room. It was spotless and consisted of a bedroom, sitting room, and a small kitchen and bathroom. The views from the room were great and a Starbucks (for morning coffee) was right across the street. We parked the car and walked everywhere... There are several excellent restaurants within one block and you literally cross the street and walk onto the seawall to access Stanley Park. You are a bit far from the downtown core and you would probably have to drive or take the bus to reach the shopping malls, but we weren't there for the shopping, so this didn't matter to us. We had great walks into the park and around Lost Lagoon, beautiful eagles flew right by our hotel window and we enjoyed the view of the ocean beach. A short walk along the sea wall towards the south gets you to the Aquabus dock, where a little water taxi takes you across the water in about 3 minutes to Granville Island, where many shops and restuarants are located. This is also a great place to buy fresh produce and baked goods to take back to your room. The Slyvia Hotel is a heritage building, built in 1912, so it isn't a modern upscale place and it definitely has an older feel, but if you are planning to visit Stanley Park, the Vancouver Aquarium, Granville Island, or the West End of Vancouver, you couldn't ask for a better location. Park you car, walk everywhere, enjoy the view and the nearby restaurants. A perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, facilities and service!”
Reviews.Author: Next_adventure27
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the staff at the restaurant and hotel, for helping create a truly memorable experience. This hotel is truly unique in its character and value!

Reviews.Title: “Genteel decline”
Reviews.Author: WorldMutt
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia might have been wonderful in its halcyon days, but it's barely apparent today. The rooms are in disrepair: broken closet doors, insufficient heat in the winter, motel quality bathrooms. The staff is friendly but not professional. The rooms are large, but you don't really want to spend much time in them...so choose Sylvia for its location. The view is amazing, if you have one, and the location can't be beat. I think that's also why this hotel can 'rest on its laurels' and still count on business during a genteel decline.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: NanEdKirkland
Reviews.Content: We visit Vancouver often, but this was a first stay at the Sylvia. We were very pleased with our find. The suite (an upgrade) was quirky, but comfy, clean and spacious. Best of all for us was the super staff who are all pet friendly. Our Mai Lei loved the attention and treats each time she went by the front desk. We'll be back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, ideal location, and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Cabana76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a little "stay-cation". A fantastic view of English Bay greeted us in the morning when I went out to Delany's for our coffee. The hotel is very pet friendly and all staff who encountered our two labradors offered them cookies and gave them some love. A nice, quiet bar downstairs is ideal for having a couple of cocktails at the end of the evening. We will return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Robert_Robson
Reviews.Content: My wife, her parents and I stayed in two rooms at the Sylvia over Christmas 2011. The hotel is right across the street from English Bay, giving many rooms a view of one of the most scenic spots in Vancouver. Stanley Park, plus many good shops and restaurants are very close, and downtown can be reached by a very short bus or taxi ride, or even a pleasant walk through the West End's residential streets. The nine-story pre-WWI hotel is a Vancouver landmark, its vine-covered brick walls giving it the comfy look of an old dowager. I've stayed at the Sylvia many times over the last few decades (!), but was surprised this time at how good the rooms looked. They seem to have been spruced up with new furniture and paint, but without clashing with the building's style. Without going into too much detail, we made some heavy demands of the catering staff during one of their busiest times, and they amazed us with their kindness, thoroghness and efficiency. The hotel staff seem like one big family, and the decorations throughout the lobby and restaurant made the place seem even more homey. During our stay, we overheard a guest complaining rudely to the front desk that his room was not as large as one he had on a previous stay, and he demanded a larger room. The desk clerk quietly and professionally filled the man's request, despite the fact the hotel was likely full. It reminded us to take with a grain of salt any negative reviews we see for properties that seem to get generally good reviews. Some people are harder to please or simply have a bad day - these things should not be allowed to damage a good hotel's reputation. The Sylvia is a friendly older hotel with loads of character and in a superb location. They do a great job at looking after their guests, and the rooms are clean, comfortable, and well appointed. And it's surprisingly quiet from adjoining rooms and the street. If this kind of property tickles your fancy, you will love the Sylvia.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Bigred4u
Reviews.Content: As travellers from Australia it is always hard to know exactly where is the best location to stay in a city. We were not disappointed by the Sylvia. It is not one of you intimidating big hotel-have stayed at many of those - it is a hotel were you can get to know all the staff and they become friends in a very short time. We were lucky to be able to stay for a week. Sure the room was small-but had a great big walk in wardrobe(Great for excess baggage). We were out and about all day so it was great to come home and have a shower and rest in one of the most comfortable beds we have slept in. Location could not be faulted asthe hotel is so close to restaurants, public transport, park and walks. Would we stay again? Sure would

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Service”
Reviews.Author: NorthernAlice
Reviews.Content: If in real estate it is location, location, location, what I want in a hotel is location, service, room quality. I have recommended this hotel for years because when I lived in Vancouver my parents always stayed there when visiting me (I had a teensy apartment, not a bad daughter) and I saw their rooms. The rooms they had always were lovely, a bit quirky compared to a chain hotel in a positive way, and comfy, clean, spacious, and with windows that open to your view of English Bay. They would not have stayed anywhere else. I was back in Vancouver recently and of course stayed at the Sylvia. I booked very late and got a bit of an unusual room. Mostly it was fine - like being able to open the windows and have the ocean breeze flutter the ivy around the window, but the bathroom was barely okay, and frankly a bit strange and smelly. Still, anytime I go back to Vancouver, I would stay there with no question - even in the room I had this time. If it was fully booked I would have serious issues finding something even close to what I like - there is nothing else like the Sylvia. Love the location (location, location), great people, and the homely/homey feeling. I have never eaten at the hotel, but the great thing about staying here is you are in walking distance to some of the really good, off the beaten track Vancouver restaurants, including some of the best hole in the wall treasures for Sushi (Shima) and proper, full-on French dinners (The Chef and Carpenter), and gelato (Mondo Gelato - nothing but the hazelnut for me), as well as institutions like the Raincity Grill. Or just go to one of the many coffee places, grab a coffee and pastry, and sit on the beach or wander around the seawall or Stanley Park. Still love it.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean-side Gem.”
Reviews.Author: Marley23069
Reviews.Content: On the fringe of the urban core this is classic and classy Vancouver heritage hotel. Stunning views, cosy pub, good dining room. Close to ocean-side walks and the walkers' pathway through Stanley Park. A quick walk to Lions Gate Bridge and the downtown area through side by side ethnic restaurants. A unique experience in an urban location!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - but boring food”
Reviews.Author: JulianneBentley
Reviews.Content: Nice old-fashioned but clean hotel, without that lingering cigarette smoke odor so many old/historic hotels are plagued with. Great value at a very reasonable price, and lots of far-batter restaurants within just a couple of blocks. Staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A suprisingly nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Escarius
Reviews.Content: I extended my stay at the Sylvia from one to three nights as it was great. Now, right away it is not a modern hotel full of creature comforts, it has a refined classical feel of a bygone era, an era that befits the serene inspirational vista's out your window. The room was large clean and comfortable with older styled but good condition furnishings. The staff was excellent, kind and responsive(they seemed like a family). And the location was unbeatable. If you are looking for a souless modern hotel with cookie cutter features this isn't your place, but if you are looking for a warm reminder of a bygone era, with friendly staff and an out of this world location for a quite affordable price, this my friend is it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable, warmth for the family”
Reviews.Author: Burke S
Reviews.Content: A superb place for a family visit. Our son adored the books about "Mr. Got to Go," so much that several days later, he's still talking about him (ask in the lobby). The room was perfect -- great sheets on a great bed, everything in good condition, no sense that every other room in the hotel would be identical. This is so rare in this era of monotonous corporate hotels. The location could not be better. A walker's paradise into Stanley Park, and twenty restaurant choices without having to take the car. Don't miss the Banana Leaf, right around the corner. And the staff seemed genuinely happy to help. A rare treat, our stay. We'll absolutely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage comfort”
Reviews.Author: Crystal L
Reviews.Content: I've wanted to stay at the Sylvia for years and finally got my chance during grey cup this year. It was a little out of the way for hanging out downtown, but the Sylvia staff called cabs whenever we needed them, and they were always there within minutes. The rooms are smallish and old fashioned. Very cozy with great views and old style plaster walls. We didn't eat there, but the restaurant seemed really nice. You're right in the heart of an amazing food district, so I would recommend taking a little walk for dinner. It met my expectations, even exceeding them in some areas. The Sylvia isn't just a place to sleep, it's a piece of history you can sleep in. And the views and neighbourhood make it a relaxing experience, not stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that always defines our stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Kennoche
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sylvia numerous times over a couple or three decades and two words come to mind: Authenticity and tradition. While thoroughly modern in its amenities, you are quickly reminded that generations have stayed here. But there is no kitch sentimentality in the decor, no quaint shabbiness. The place is very well run. Some of the rooms are huge. The views of the bay stunning. Slip down on the terrace and people-watch the waterfront promanade and, enjoying a gin and tonic, pretend you are Graham Green thinking up his next novel. In winter, after a walk in Stanley Park in the blustery weather, snuggle in the bar for a hot cup of clam chowder or hot buttered rum. Stay in for dinner, the menu is elegant without being pretentious; and the wait staff is discrete but attentive. In other words, it makes my stay in Vancouver that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Back in time...”
Reviews.Author: ArtCarver
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy paying over the odds for a small room in a 'boutique' hotel, then the Sylvia isn't for you. Yes, it's slightly old-fashioned, but that's the charm of the place. The bathrooms don't have the latest fittings, but are clean and a decent size. The last time we stayed here, we found we had been given a suite: a good size bedroom, a bathroom, a sitting room with a dining table and chairs and a sofa that folded open into a bed and, off it, a kitchen with a full-size cooker and fridge. Even if you only used it to make yourself breakfast, this would be worth having. As for the location: ideal for walking to the shops in Denman Street or to Stanley Park. A little ferry to Granville Island is a ten-minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view and great General manager!”
Reviews.Author: Mei M
Reviews.Content: great hotel with outstanding view and location. Also staff is incredible...especially the General Manager - Ross Dyck. He is a great ambassador of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the Sylvia”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCst
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at the Sylvia many times,lovely heritage hotel, great location and the staff are very attentive

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brenda S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sylvia before we had children. We live just outside Vancouver (Port Coquitlam) and we decided to treat ourselves to a night out (after 19 yrs) and made a reservation. We told the reservationl clerk that this was a special weekend for us and would really like an ocean room (none were available). I asked that if one became available, we would love to be upgraded. Upon check in, we were surprised to have been given a wonderful partial ocean view room on the 6th floor. We had a wonderful stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast on Sunday was also great. Our waiter, Ized, was very funny, a gifted server and was attentive to our needs. He added a personal touch by asking us about our stay and why we were away for the weekend. His personal touch and humour added to our enjoyable stay and our breakfast experience. The location of the hotel is perfect, as we parked our car and didn't use it until we checked out. There are alot of hotels in Vancouver, but if you are looking for the oceanside, walks in Stanley Park, or shopping along Denman or Robson, this hotel is the perfect location. We will definately be back and next time, we will be bring our friends.Thanks for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere that feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Terry D
Reviews.Content: My youngest son now lives in Vancouver so I travel to see him often. When in Vancouver I stay At The Sylvia Hotel on English Bay. I am at my home away from home. It is an older hotel with lots of history and great management and staff with excellent service. Here is an example of how things work at The Sylvia. My wife was coming to see our son for a few days earlier this year. I had met the manager Ross Dyck and was impressed by dedication to service. I called Ross and asked if I could have a gift basket with some flowers, fruit etc. left for my wife in her room. "No problem. What can I do" was the managers response. My wife arrived to flowers mixed fruit, chocolate and a nice card. She still talks about that little surprise. The other thing I love here is the windows actually open....easily...Fresh ocean air is so nice for sleeping. The Sylvia's restaurant and lounge are casual and have the finest view of English Bay I have experienced. Would you like a reasonably priced pleasant surprise. Next time you are I Vancouver check out the Sylvia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, old hotel on a great spot”
Reviews.Author: DixieNetherlands
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Sylvia Hotel before and we were not disappointed this time. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly staff. I had changed our original reservation but everything was in order when we arrived. Our room was spacious and the bed was fine. This is an older hotel but for us that gives it something extra. I don't know if there are rooms with a coffeemachine and a fridge but ours didn't. It would have been nice to be able to make a cup of tea or coffee. The hotel is situated on a great spot near English Bay and Denman Street. We like the fact that we can leave our car in the garage and explore the city by foot. The food in the hotel is great but if you want to eat out there are a lot of restaurants nearby. When we return to Vancouver we will certainly stay in the Sylvia!

Reviews.Title: “Sylvia Hotel, Vancouver, Canada”
Reviews.Author: Terry B
Reviews.Content: Used to be a great hotel; now terribly run down. Wonderful location on English Bay but that is all it has going for it. Stayed four nights and after the first night let the front desk know that the shower worked like it had prostate issues. Nothing was done. For after dark entertainment you can watch the rats run up and down the ivy that covers the front of the hotel. Upon reading this review if you still decide to stay at the Sylvia, keep your windows closed at night or you could wind up sharing your room with the rats. Could not find another place to stay or would have changed hotels after the first night. Would rate this hotel as 'terrible' but the staff is nice and helpful but that doesn't make up for the mess this once great landmark has become.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location- friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend and it was the highlight of our trip to Vancouver. Located right outside Stanley park and on the English Bay, you cannot beat the location. The hotel is old but kept up- very European. The staff went above and beyond and we cannot wait to visit again. Thanks from Minnesota!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: erjennif
Reviews.Content: We received great service from the Sylvia Hotel. We had an event planned to take place at the Sylvia, but unfortunately had to change plans at the last minute due to a death in the family. The staff and management were understanding and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “I'll not return to the Sylvia...”
Reviews.Author: DianeSSeattle
Reviews.Content: I will not stay at the Sylvia Hotel again, even though it’s been my hotel of choice in Vancouver for many years. The reason is that when I arrived for a stay I had booked three months in advance, the reception desk said they had no record of my request. And I had forgotten to bring my reservation confirmation number. They also had no reservation under my name because someone there had misspelled my name, even though they had it correctly on my credit card. Upon arrival I was told that room I had booked was not available but other accommodation could be found, of course at a much higher price. Because I’ve only ever stayed at the Syliva, I agreed to the change and ended up paying double. However, several weeks later I found their electronic confirmation of the date of my original reservation and noticed for the first time that my last name was misspelled (one letter wrong). I called the manager and explained that I had their communication confirming the date I had originally requested. Of course I felt some refund was due because of their errors. But, no, she said. It was entirely my fault for not remembering to bring the confirmation number. It was nothing to do with them. And I should have informed them at once of the misspelling. Everything that had gone wrong was my fault – not theirs. I received no apology and was interrupted every time I tried to make a point. I am very disappointed that a repeat client could be treated in such a manner and as a result of the lack of simple courtesy I will not return. Surely there are hotels in Vancouver where clients are treated with respect and not so summarily dismissed.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in a great position for Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: lawrence_97
Reviews.Content: Although no longer the top place in town the hotel has a historic charm. Our room was large and comfortable but lacked modern conveniences such as a coffee maker and air con. However the location is great if you want to explore Stanley Park and English Bay but a little further out from the attractions of Gas town and Downtown. We enjoyed this more peaceful location. The hotel bar has great views and good prices for a city location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eveynz
Reviews.Content: Second time I've stayed at the Sylvia, grew up in Vancouver and the Sylvia has always had a special place in my heart..coming back as an adult I decided to stay with 2 other girlfriends for 4 nights. Comfortable spacious room, fantastic location across from English Bay. Staff very friendly and helpful...Good choice of tasty breakfasts. Appreciated the use of the free computer in the lobby. The only criticism (if you could call it one) we wished tea and coffee facility was in our room..got to have that coffee first thing!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful getaway”
Reviews.Author: Nicole H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location,, The hotel front desk was very accommodating. I loved the antique structure amazed by the creative artistic displays .i took lots of photos for sure . The packed deal at this time of year blew me away for the amount of luxury's that was provided while i stayed at the Sylvia Hotel . I was intrigued by all the ivy. Loved the breakfast overlooking the ocean. all meal prices were affordable and classy and delicious. I really enjoyed the down time in the evening, while in the pub listening to live jazz while sitting by the fireplace sipping on tea .The hotel rooms were clean comfortable lots of pillows slept like a queen overlooking the boat house and all the busy people passing by on the street below . A must see and experience. looking forward to staying for Sylvia s 100 birthday . I heard through the grape vine a new promotion and experience per month for the whole year.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate room, but a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: 8travelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for a short trip to Vancouver to see friends, who routinely stay at this hotel. It's what everyone says: a bit funky (ok, the property is 100 years old), but our room was updated and fairly comfortable, in a standard mid-range kind of way. We overlooked a leafy, quiet side street; the windows were openable (a big plus for us). Bathroom pretty basic, but clean and manageable. I was most impressed by the staff. They seem very well trained, knowledgeable; they did everything they could to be helpful. A good price for this location.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the sylvia”
Reviews.Author: mtnbikerScottsdale
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in mid-August. Great location for Stanley park and the local beach You can walk around Stanley park one direction and along the ocean to Granville island ferry access in the other In beautiful neighborhood, near many restaurants, shops, coffee places Room spacious, bed comfortable, bathroom nice Great, helpful staff Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay if You Want to Explore”
Reviews.Author: mizstacey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sylvia for 5 nights in mid August with my husband and his 16-year old twin daughters. We loved the hotel, loved our rooms, and had the best little vacation imaginable. The location of this hotel is the very best - hands down. From the hotel, we struck out each day to explore Vancouver. We rode bikes around Stanley Park one morning; we walked downtown several times; we walked to Gas Town, Yale Town, and Chinatown; we took the ferry to the market under the bridge. All these outings were very easy and safe. We ate at the Sylvia and enjoyed our meal - we also ate at nearby Rain City and Simba's a couple of times each. Wonderful restaurants all. The weather during our trip was perfect...we even had the surprise of seeing 2,000 zombies arrive in the park one late afternoon. That was a "once in a lifetime" event. Don't even think about staying any place other than the Sylvia. Reasonable rates, clean, comfortable rooms, comfy beds, and killer location. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location - Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: bensagle
Reviews.Content: Amazing location right on English Bay next to Stanley Park. Cheap considering where it is. Funky low-key apartment suites. A hotel with history and charm. Super expensive restaurant. No wi-fi in rooms, which forces you to go to the lobby and become part of the Sylvia clique. Limited parking. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Changelatitudes
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel searching for a place on our last night in Vancouver. It's a real gem. It's an old hotel - 99 years young - but clean and in a great location. English Bay park/beach is right across the street and was a great place to people-watch and catch an amazing sunset. Lots of good restaurants easy walking distance. Easy walk to Stanley Park as well and their great Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Dream location near English Bay and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: rlennon1
Reviews.Content: This is a decent and clean hotel with friendly and responsive staff. They were always cheerful and helped me with directions whenever I needed. This is an older building and rooms are of an older style. That becomes obvious with the older-style wall plugs (some of mine didn't seem to work) and old fashioned keys (no key cards here). These aren't big deals and I enjoyed my stay. There are a few improvements that the hotel could make to the room. For example, the walk-in closet is great, but there's no light in there and it could definitely use one. Key card systems are standard in hotels these days and could be used here -- as it is now, you're supposed to leave your key at the desk every time you exit the hotel. Some of the bathroom light switches are above the mirror and would be out of reach for some guests. Finally, it felt odd having open windows with pigeons strolling and cooing constantly on the ledge right outside - it may not be a big deal, but it took away from the view and it seemed unsanitary to me to have pigeons hanging around so close by. This hotel's real selling point - and this overshadows everything - is its incredible location just off the beach at English Bay. You can literally cross the street and go suntanning or take a stroll or run around the seawall. Just down the street, on Denman, are bike rental places that can equip you with bikes. Also nearby are hundreds of restaurants and coffee shops covering just about every type of cuisine imaginable. If you're looking to relax in Vancouver, this is the place to be. To get here by transit, grab a bus at the Yaletown Skytrain Station (on the Canada Line from the airport) - many of them go down Davie all the way to Denman which is the nearest major intersection.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the location and value”
Reviews.Author: 2go
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days here and loved the location! Next to Stanley Park and 200 feet from the walking/ bike path and the beach. This is not a hotel for everyone if you're expecting a Marriott. It is an old historic building... with a European feel. Lighting in the room was minimal... a ceiling fan or floor fan would've made a huge difference in the stuffiness. my room was small and the bathroom incredibly tiny. But I wasn't in the room that much. Bus stop was only 2 blocks away and very easy to figure out where you want to go. The whole city is very walkable and navigating is a breeze. Everyone was very friendly ! The Hop on- hop off bus is just across the street a block down. Many many restaurants on Denman street.... very walkable and felt very safe at all times. HOTEL Value was ok.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: artlover0346
Reviews.Content: Vancouver being a world class city probably has many hotels more grand and sophisticated than the Sylvia, but I would never stay anywhere else. The Sylvia a vine covered facade and original signage. Inside, one of the two elevators still has the metal dial that indicates the floors and the some of the lobby furniture is quite likely genuine antique but comfortable and charming. The rooms have been updated, beds are comfortable and the bathroom fittings updated and clean. The staff are always very professional and helpful ; I have always been greeted warmly by both desk staff and the dining room staff. All these attributes are important but it is the location that makes the Sylvia unique and very splendid, with a view of English Bay and easy walking to Stanley Park and Sea Wall, and in the other direction, the little ferry dock that takes passengers to Granville Island. The Sylvia is in a pretty residential area with lots of restaurants and shops nearby and Robson Street is very walkable. If you like chrome and glass and leather and sterile lobbies, you won't find The Sylvia to your liking but if you like the feeling of a hotel well used and loved, you will feel at home here.

Reviews.Title: “Old.......”
Reviews.Author: beenthere088
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sylivia in Vancouver in August 2011. The room was old and very small and stuffy but clean. Was very noisy outside on Fri- Sat nights. What is with Canadian Hotels and a lack of lighting in the rooms? As far as old hotels go it is OK in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: catofl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and overall had a good feeling about the hotel. Maybe it's a little bit overpriced. The location is very nice, near Stanley Park and on walking distance from the centre. The room was a bit old and a bit noisy, but it was OK. We did not bring our own computer, but we could use one in the lobby. Breakfast (with view on English Bay!) was good, although not included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: AnitaMW
Reviews.Content: We booked a Harbor View room at the Sylvia Hotel on the advise of friends who stayed there often. It is in a great location, next to Stanley Park and on the bay. The hotel is very old, and there are few amenities (no AC, no fridge, no coffee (even in the lobby)), but there was free Wifi and the rooms are clean and comfortable and we could walk anywhere in the city and sit in the park with coffee in the morning. We didn't need the AC since the weather was perfect and cool at night, but that did mean we had to have our windows open at night, which we prefer anyway. There were no bugs. Our only wish was to be on a higher floor, for which we would have paid additional. Being on the second floor meant that we got the smoke from smokers below our open windows, and we had a lot of light from the street lights. The traffic noise would have been less noticeable on a higher floor too. Breakfast service was very, very slow, but once our order was placed the food came quickly. Still, the location and price outweighed the noise, and we were happy to have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucinda88420
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we came to B.C. to view the Celebration of Lights fireworks competition. The location is perfect right on English Bay, adjacent to Stanley Park. This is a very old, historic hotel and the rooms reflect that. (Don't expect modern luxurious rooms). I requested a high room #, but when we arrived they could only give me the second floor. There is an onsite parking garage for guests (extra $) from which the license plate was STOLEN off my rental car. That turned in to a huge hastle to attempt to exchange this vehicle when in a foreign country (we drove up from Seattle). The hotel was aplogetic, but there was nothing they could do to help. Maybe they need better security coverage in their garage? We only had to walk across the street to claim our spot and watch the fireworks, which were amazing. The beach was PACKED! And it was very nice to just run up to our room for bathroom breaks instead of using the smelly porta-potties on the beach. The morning of our checkout we wanted to try the Hotels restaurant for breakfast. We stood at the check-in podium with a few other people waiting for a hostess.... no one ever came. We can easily see inside the restaurant as 5 or 6 waiters served people and walked by us numerous times. No one ever helped us. After about 5 or 10 minutes of waiting with other parties, we left. They should have one less waiter to have someone standing at the checkin desk. They lost our business that morning and we walked elsewhere. Good thing there are tons of shops and restaurants in walking distance! Next time we will try another hotel. The combination of the above problems kinda spoiled our 3 nights in B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Wait for renovations before you book”
Reviews.Author: Wargreg
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia has charm, a pleasant staff, a good location on English Bay and practically next to Stanley Park, and a decent restaurant and solid bar. The hotel itself needs to be renovated... room was pretty shabby with no air conditioning...and the windows didn't have screens so I had a few flies to keep me company. If you are a light sleeper It would be tough to get some shut eye. The bathroom rally needed a marble and tile facelift.

Reviews.Title: “65th Anniversary (65 years later at the Sylvia)”
Reviews.Author: bluboni
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and friendly and the location is breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “not in my Lifetime !”
Reviews.Author: duslbeck
Reviews.Content: we where staying at the Sylvia for a Wedding . The Service for the Price we paid was plain terrible. The Ocean or Harbour View was none existent . All we looked at was a Wall of Tree's , altough we paid extra for an Harbour View. No Coffee Machine , Fridge etc. The Bathroom was like a Closet , tight and narrow. Not what I expected for $490.00 . And the Front end Staff was not very helpfull or unwilling to do so. Overall not a good Experience.

Reviews.Title: “The location itself is worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: onediogenes1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent ten days at the Sylvia in August 2011. Full disclosure: we discovered this hotel some twenty years ago and have been traveling there ever since. The hotel is situated next to Stanley Park (probably the best city park in the world), and we were meters away from the beach (visible from our hotel windows). The location is perfect. The hotel is old and those who are looking for Bauhaus-style or Louis XVI-style furniture etc. will be disappointed. The Sylvia is very British and very modest in its room appointments. But the beds were spotless, the pillows just right, our kitchenette acceptable, and so was the restaurant (those who like English breakfast will give it higher marks than I). Miles of trails in Stanley Park and around the peninsula/seawall. Informal surroundings, yet with a touch of that Britishness that makes things predictable and orderly. I give the hotel an A; I once traveled to Vancouver on business and stayed in a posh hotel downtown, but I would not exchange Sylvia for it. If you like nature and a relaxed yet civilized atmosphere, Sylvia is for you.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every summer”
Reviews.Author: bobbirm
Reviews.Content: When we visit our children and grandchildren in Seattle we stay at the Sylvia for one week every summer, sometimes just my husband and me and sometimes we take a suite and stay with our teenage grandchildren. It is old fashioned and does not have a/c but we like it. It rarely gets very hot in Vancouver and the Sylvia is right on English Bay with nice windows that open to the fresh air and breezes. A corner room on an upper floor is best because you can get a cross breeze. The restaurant is good and well located by the water. The staff is friendly and helpful. Once we park our car at the Sylvia (for a daily fee) we walk everywhere. Many restaurants and shops are very close. We love the prepared food at Capers/Whole Foods which can be a savings over the restaurants. All in all the Sylvia is our favorite over the more "modern" standard, and usually more expensive, hotels. At night there is lots of activity by the Bay and often music groups to entertain. Stanley Park is a walk or bike ride away and also has a huge (and I do mean huge) swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location......grand hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Face1234
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Sylvia a number of times and always enjoy it. We usually ask for the same room - 422 or 622. This is a corner room with a view of English Bay toward Stanley Park (actually it's a suite with a bedroom and living room). The room has a small kitchenette (modernized a bit the last time we stayed there) but sufficient for some cooking. We stayed a week and used public transportation to explore Vancouver and the surrounding area. The lcoation is the best part - when you get up in the morning you can have breakfast overlooking English Bay - on a sunny day it's beautiful. We had quite a few sunny days on the last trip. And at night you get a beautiful sunset. FYI - we used the new skytrain to get to and from the airport - we took a taxi to the subway stop - this worked well. The hotel recommended alteratives for us (no airporter to the hotel). We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelling_elisa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a perfect position in Vancouver: you can enjoy a beautiful view on the seaside and a lot of restaurants at walking distance. The hotel is very old fashioned and the the staff was friendly and helpful. Free High Speed Internet connection is available for all the guests. Our room was quite small (with a huge tv that we would have gladly exchanged for a little more space) but well cleaned. The bathroom was nice and clean as well. We would just suggest a renovation of the corridors which seem to be falling into decay, while the hall and the rooms are renovated and polished. On the whole, should we go again to Vancouver we would stay again at Sylvia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Ghiapet
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at the Sylvia Hotel was very pleseant. The location is by far a "big plus" as it is located across from the beach and adjacent to Stanley Park. The hotel staff was very helpful with info and overall friendly. The hotel has a nice bar that overlooks the beach. The one downside of the hotel is that it is dated. The rooms while acceptable, have not been updated for many years and the bathroom is extremely small. There are few ammenities included with the room (no coffee or air conditioning). Ovearll, our stay was nice and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but for the price..."”
Reviews.Author: Northfield
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and very clean. However, the towels remind you of something you would get in a budget hotel/motel. Also, the staff kept telling us the room would be ready in a few minutes. Over an hour later we gave up and started our siteseeing. They wasted our time by not being honest about when the room would be ready. That was quite disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots if personality!”
Reviews.Author: Wilberries
Reviews.Content: This hotel has tons of interesting history preserved over time and showcased via photos displayed on the walls. Regular customers return year after year particularly in the summer when the ocean beach across the street is at its busiest. We had a suite with a kitchen and queen bed and sofa bed. Queen bed was great but sofa bed was noisy and uncomfortable. Location is fantastic for beautiful English Bay and Stanley Park (20 min walk) and Robson Street (10 min walk). Rooms are clean and downstairs restaurant is good and reasonably priced. Rooms are also nice and quiet for sleeping. Parking is $15 per night but is expensive everywhere in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rburke1
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have stayed here and the experience is always the same. Good People and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost... This place is a rip off.”
Reviews.Author: TravelisLondon
Reviews.Content: An odd, unpleasant odor fills the entire hotel. The rooms are old fashioned -without any irony or charm -and generally have a depressing decor. The food at the restaurant downstairs is worthy of a cheap diner and the service at reception is unfriendly and poor. The are infinitely better places to stay in this city for what they charge, and certainly for much less. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: whidbeyIsgal
Reviews.Content: beautiful spot in the west end, so convenient to activities in English Bay area and downtown, great for the summer fireworks competition as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, and a "quaint" atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Bellingham_WAFudge
Reviews.Content: We tried the Sylvia after many years of thinking about it. It is an older hotel, but situated right across the street from a parkway and English Bay in Vancouver. The room (no view) was surprisingly large, with ample sofa and armchair in one half, the bed in the other. Apparently the hotel has been a hotel, then an apartment building, and again a hotel, so it explains the size and the layout. I do fear, though, that a person over six two or three might have real difficulty using the toilet. As it was, one had to get one's knees under the counter (in a created opening) while sitting. All was clean, paint fresh - or looked that way - and neat. The closet was big. One could keep a trunk there, if one still used a trunk. The real plus, to my mind, was accessibility to the walk/bikeway that goes around Vancouver. I could walk into Stanley Park with ease. On the way it is easy to observe the water, ships, yachts, and a variety of wildlife. Most interesting were a pair of raccoons in a tide pool, scratching underwater for brunch. There are people out walking, and it is a very small town feel, even while one is in a major Canadian city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: newanne
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from 3 nights at the Sylvia Hotel. The location is ideal. The hotel itself could use a bit of updating. The staff was friendly, and helpful. Breakfast was reasonably priced. Feel the hotel is a bit overpriced for the condition of the hotel. They do charge for parking, but that seems to be the norm for Vancouver hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just About Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: It's not the newest, nor the flashiest, and yes there are some worn spots and a few head-scratching nooks and crannies, but the Sylvia delivers comfort, convenience, and sophistication with understated style. We had a king suite on the seventh floor and were treated to a stunning view and deep quiet, along with a full kitchen and separate living room. There were closets galore and when we ordered coffee, it arrived promptly, hot and delicious at a minimal cost. Parking is simple, with a garage under accessed by a private elevator. The desk clerk even let my sister park for free there when she came to visit us. The neighborhood is the best in downtown Vancouver with access to the funky stores and eateries on Denman and to the beautiful Stanley Park. The restaurant and bar are classic with direct overlook of English Bay. A very relaxing stay for three of us. We'd go back to the Sylvia ANYtime.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: GilWatkins
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Sylvia for many years. It is like "coming home" each year. We always feel so welcome by the courteous and amenable staff. I cannot say enough good things about staying at the Sylvia. I would also add that the restaurant and bar are excellent choices for dining or drinks with scenic English Bay views. This hotel isn't for everyone. If you are looking for high end everything with high speed elevators, valet parking, 24 hour room service, AC, spa, etc, then this hotel isn't for you. If you are someone who can appreciate a clean and comfortable, well managed historic hotel in a wonderful setting beside English Bay, with all of the amenities you could ever need without the frills, then you will love this very special hotel. And did I mention it happens to be located in one of the world's most beautiful and delightful cities? My only regret about staying at the Sylvia is having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is haunted”
Reviews.Author: Terianne19
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old son freaked out when we arrived. He said "mom! why did you book such an old hotel, you know it's haunted!" Turns out he was right. We stayed in room 604 which has a seperate room with a twin bed which I slept in to get some peace and quiet. Someone sat on me twice, then tried to lie down. It was annoying, since I was not able to get back to sleep. I asked the early morning agent about anything being reported, he did say he's been poked while brushing his teeth in the restroom, but no one is around. The rooms smell moldy, but the location is great, and the restaurant and bar is good.

Reviews.Title: “Like visiting your favourite aunt...”
Reviews.Author: KerryMontreal
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's not like all of those other hotels that offer first-rate amenities, newspapers at the door and robes in the bathroom. Had enough of those? Because they all look the same. But at the Sylvia, you get the best location in Vancouver in a landmark hotel which is truly part of the history of the city and a feeling of charm that creeps out at you from all corners, recalling by-gone days of glory, hard times and yes, even resurrection. There's hope for all of us with a few wrinThe Sylvia is a magical place. We reserved a day ahead for two nights, and upon arriving got upgraded to a one bedroom with kitchen and LR/DR on the corner overlooking English Bay. Oh man, did that ever feel good walking in that room. Nine - count 'em - nine full windows that all opened, letting in the ocean breezes and sounds of the west end. Walking out of the hotel, you have English Bay at your doorstep, left to the beach, right to the seawall, which we took all the way around Stanley Park to Coal Harbour and then to town. You couldn't ask for a better location if your goal is to just breathe in the atmosphere of this beautiful city. That night we had a great dinner in the restaurant overlooking the sunset on the beach with great staff and lots of attention. A family run hotel this size is almost impossible to find nowadays, let alone in such a great spot. This one has been in the same hands since the 50's. Sure it's a little tired and her wrinkles are showing, but like visiting your favourite aunt, the one that always loved you best, it's a pleasure to visit her over and over, not just because she's got the best pad on the beach. Strongly recommended as a break from the 4 star uniformity out there. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: kittyluna
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia Hotel is comparable to being home. It is a fine respit from the hustle and bustle of Downtown Vancouver and yet within walking distance to everything. I just walked around Stanley Park and found the views breathtakingly beautiful and wound up back at the Sylvia, happy to get back into my very quiet and charming room. The staff are very friendly es[ecially Christian nd Kyel at the desk! And have exchanged my US dollars at par, better than any bank or exchange office. Being right on the English Bay is fabulous and a stone's throw from Denman street where restaurants and shops abound. You can also conveniently catch a bus to sights beyond. I would always return to the Sylvia because it has stolen my heart. ENJOY.......

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but mouse in room”
Reviews.Author: LaJaques
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night in the Sylvia, based on a recommendation we read in Sunset magazine. While the location was great, our hotel room was not. Our room was in the old wing of the hotel and within 5 minutes of entering the very small room, a mouse ran over my husband's foot while he was using the toilet. We called the front desk and they sent up a guy with three Orkin sticky strips and let us know that if we heard any squeaking we could call the front desk and they would send someone up to dispose of the offending mouse. And that was it. No offer to switch rooms, no complementary drinks in the bar, no discount, just some sticky strips on the floor that we had to avoid for the rest of our stay. Closer inspection of the room found many mouse holes in the drywall that had been painted over, so it was rather obvious that they have had this mouse problem for a while. I was disgusted with the complete lack of concern over this health issue. We will not be returning to the Sylvia and would not recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, superb service in an incredible heritage hotel!!! Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola1979a
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during the Stanley cup playoffs and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect ... Including the fantastic breakfast room service! It is located on the sea wall of Stanley park. The service was fantastic and we were even given personal attention from the hotel manager. Thanks Ross! Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: SkittlesWV
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Sylvia Hotel! The best thing about the Sylvia is the location. It is located on the English Bay right next to Stanley Park. We loved being so close to the sea wall. The hotel is also located next to Denman street which is home to a variety of restaurants, bike rental shops, and a grocery store. The West End is a wonderful and safe part of Vancouver with much to offer. Everyone at the Sylvia was very helpful. They were always willing to help if we had questions about how to get somewhere by bus. The room was small;however, we were expecting it and felt that it was big enough for the both of us. We felt it was a good value for the cost. This hotel cost much less than I thought it would due to it's excellent location. The only thing I would have liked that the room did not have, was ventilation in the bathroom. We would definately stay at the Sylvia again! I don't think we would even cosider staying anywhere else is we were to make a return visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: mikecheswick
Reviews.Content: Recently i booked a spur of the moment trip to Vancouver to see game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals. I was on a major hotel reservations website, looking for a place to stay, and the Sylvia was the first one with rooms available. I had heard the name Sylvia Hotel before, but had only seen it from a distance. I love the location, nice and quiet at nighttime, and being on English Bay. This was especially good considering the events of earlier this week! The Sylvia is a nice blend of rustic charm and modern amenities. I enjoyed the LCD TV and clear reception, most hotels I have been to still have those old style, smallish TVs that tend to have poor reception. The food in the restaurant was amazing! Not cheap but well worth the money! The view from the property is amazing, next time I will book further in advance so I can get an ocean view room! I also find that the Sylvia offers great value compared to other properties in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent location by the sea but you can walk into town”
Reviews.Author: PaulinVence
Reviews.Content: Needed a 2 bedroom apartment, which they had at a competitive price including underground parking. The hotel is old and a little faded but comfortable. Service was excellent and the rooms quiet. The BIG plus was the location next door to Stanley Park and the waterway footpath that leads into town. 15 minutes from the hotel brings you to the first of the little ferry stops which are a jem. $15 gets you the royal tour up to the Science Museum and back with as many stop offs and pick ups as you like. The footpaths are great by the water and reminds me a bit of Brisbane. A good stay, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel and we'd like to return. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: argus23
Reviews.Content: Located in a heritage building, our room had been refurbished and was extremely comfortable. Although the hotel had entertainment and a popular bar, no noise reached us from revellers. No kitchenette, but location was near Denman St (buses and cafes, plus supermarket), and also close to bay and park. Staff were helpful and looked after us lost Australians.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- across from English Bay, not far from shopping & restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: capoheaven
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights the Thurs & Friday before Memorial day weekend for concert. Paid $405 U.S. total for two queen bed room on 2nd floor- mildly overpriced. Cab from YVR was a little under $40. Quaint, old style building and decor in a fabulous location. Staff very friendly and rooms were average. Enjoyed one delicious beer (Raven Lager) in downstairs bar, did not eat. Would return 3.75 / 5.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little Gem, close to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: Jfootz
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here. And I loved it, it would have been nicer if we had a room facing the ocean. But the bed was very cozy. And the restaurant serves a very lovely breakfast. I would recommend the blueberry pancakes to anyone. It's a half hour walk to the aquarium and 15min to Stanley park. Your right on the sea wall of the English bay your very close to Granville island. Your very close to Denman street, where there are very cute restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: rugbcoach
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the sylvia. The service is top shelf, the location is amazing and the staff is first-rate. Old world charm and a very good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, Fun”
Reviews.Author: I-heart-Travel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading other TripAdvisor reviews. This place is spot on a fun place to be. Built in 1912 as a 77-room apartment house, it boasts eclectic furniture in each room. Don't expect the Waldorf here, but do expect something that won't disappoint. Besides, it's right on the beach. Our room featured a small (perhaps unusually so) bathroom with a painted over window that once looked into who-knows-what. The restaurant is reasonably priced but the food is better than that. The staff is friendly and accommodating. It's within walking distance (one block) from many varied restaurants on Denman Street. Parking is underground accessible from Pendrell. Definitely a place we'll be returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Hotel Bar”
Reviews.Author: kden604
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my wife and we had a drink in the bar. When we went to pay, she added extra drinks to the bill. I told her simply, there is something wrong with the bill, not further elaborating. She replied "I know" took the bill back with asking what specifically was wrong, then fixed the bill correctly. She basically knew she gave me a padded bill. Was not happy with this at all. Poor service, understaffed, padded bill. Hotel itself was decent, good location, Spartan rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and great value”
Reviews.Author: fernandovalenzuela
Reviews.Content: could be maintained better. Dont stay here if you are looking for nice new furnishings and beds. But if you want a great location at a fair price...this is the one

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Friendly Staff, Good Food”
Reviews.Author: Maynem
Reviews.Content: We have visited Vancouver for years, and stayed at some of the best hotels (Pan Pacific etc..) this was our 1st visit to the Sylvia, we liked it so much we are booked to go back the end of this month. Wish we had known about it sooner. The location is picturesque, and just a short trip to the mountain, snow, skating and sking. The best of both worlds! .

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: rallysport7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came for a relaxing weekend - having English Bay across the street is a treat and Stanley park for a nice walk - will be back in the summer to enjoy with warmer weather. We love the location to be able to come back and relax after a day of shopping. The staff and service was most helpful. We love the charm of the old hotel and found it to be a place we will come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Jessles
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Sylvia! The staff was very friendly and our room was gorgeous! Thanks for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little historic gem”
Reviews.Author: Fletch85
Reviews.Content: I won't hear a bad word about this hotel. It has everything you'd want from a hotel in Vancouver. I've stayed here several times and always had a great time. You have the beach, Stanley park and downtown all within your grasp. The hotel was one of the first buildings in Vancouver and yes the floor boards are a bit wonky in places but in my opinion it just adds to the charm.

Reviews.Title: “needs refurb”
Reviews.Author: elviradaphne
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on a Thursday night. The reception was not very welcoming. I was not offered help with my luggage. The room was cold the corridors shabby. I was not aware that animals were allowed in the hotel and was surprised to see a large dog staring at me from the next room. The room was cold. There was no kettle , tea cofee making facilities or fridge. I feel the hotel needs a refurb and is overpriced. Having said that the building and location are beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and lovely refuge”
Reviews.Author: EHanson
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at Sylvia for a long time although have often enjoyed the quiet ambience of the lounge overlooking English Bay.. Lovely to re make acquaintance with The Sylvia. Nothing fancy but very welcoming and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Best charm, price, and location in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: stlueymo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, with my husband on romantic getaways, with my daughter and grandchildren for fun on the beach and at the Aquarium, and meeting friends for a sightseeing adventure. The Sylvia is without a doubt the best location at the edge of Stanley Park and across the street from the beach at English Bay. It is a very walkable city, with plenty of buses and small water ferries (Aqua Bus and False Creek Ferries) as well as fantastic markets (Granville Island ) and museums and absolutely amazing choices for eating on Denman St. nearby. The staff is fantastic, there is a lounge and restaraunt right in the hotel with fireplace and sweeping view. Did I mention free wifi?

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel But Not for Vanilla Travellers”
Reviews.Author: altacouple
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sylvia every time I'm in Vancouver, which is about every 6-8 weeks. In fact, I was just there last Friday. It's been my primary Vancouver abode when travelling there for over 20 years! For me it has everything, an incredible location on the beach a block away from Stanley Park, innumerable shopping and dining experiences nearby, and an atmosphere you won't find anywhere. Now for the hard facts. This hotel is in fact an elderly apartment building from the 1910's "renovated" into a hotel a long time ago. What renovated means is that they took the apartments and chopped them up. Some are big, some are small, none (at least in the old section of the hotel) are of standard size, shape or configuration. The furnishings have been upgraded over the last few years (if you think they are funky now, you should have seen them in the 80's) but luxurious is not a word applied at this hotel. Unique, quirky and irresistably charming do apply, but you must be in the right mood. This is not a boutique hotel. The building is old, the rooms of mixed caliber and decor, the plumbing variable(the higher up you go, the more the water pressure varies) and the heat (in winter) inconsistent. However, the food in the restaurant is excellent, room service prompt, the staff are incredible and the guests range from European hikers to American tourists and everything in between. You don't have to worry about rowdies or low life's, it's not cheap (though there are some deals on the smaller rooms - be warned though, they mean small) and your typical guest is likely to be more boomer than Gen X'er. Lovers of the more typical North American hotel experience would more likely enjoy themselves at the Coast Hotel on Denman, just a block away. Overall, if you like quirky, can handle some inconsistencies in amenities and don't get freaked by a total lack of Holiday Inn uniformity, then the Sylvia is for you. Reservations are a must, especially in summer. Personally, I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean trip back in time”
Reviews.Author: kfyke40
Reviews.Content: This old hotel has retained all the charm of the past and offers excellent service and friendly staff. It's beachfront location offers walking to Stanley Park and the downtown stores. The food is great and if you want variety there are excellent places to dine within walking distance. Wonderful retreat for a few days away from home

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay with a dog!!”
Reviews.Author: judyisflyfishing
Reviews.Content: We usually stay 2-3 times a year ...the only place to stay in Vancouver with a dog. The hotel is fabulous, with a wonderful friendly staff, who by the way know our dog, and have treats behind the desk. Easy walking distance to downtown, the beach and the fabulous Stanley park. This is my hotel of choice even without the dog...

Reviews.Title: “A jewel among hotels. I could spend the rest of my life here.”
Reviews.Author: Noor1
Reviews.Content: I love the Sylvia. I adore the Sylvia. I would happily spend the rest of my life at the Sylvia. Now for the hard facts: it is in the heart of the West End, perfectly placed and overlooking the ocean and/or mountains, depending on your room: the sea wall walk around Stanley Park is just out the door. Everybody is helpful and friendly and easy: I don't think I've ever met such a comfortable, low-key, yet perfectly efficient team of people as work in the Sylvia, in all my life. Really. The rooms are comfortable (in winter book a room in the new-built section, as some rooms in the old side can be chilly if the wind is wrong), clean, well-designed. The water is always hot. (The bath towels can be a bit thin. But that is the only, and I do mean only, downside.) It's got a great bar and coffee shop, and is a perfect place to meet friends or hang out with your laptop. Breakfasts are good, we had one rather mediocre lunch of sandwiches, but otherwise the food in the restaurant was very good. This hotel is perfectly charming, not that I can point to any exact reason why; there's a feeling about it, as soon as you walk in the door. It was built a century ago, and its spirit seems to exist in a time capsule. Imagine 1910 courtesy with free wi-fi, and you'll about have it. I hate to leave. May it go on forever.

Reviews.Title: “Historic exterior, ordinary interior”
Reviews.Author: retro_rucksack
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I stayed in a recently renovated room, but it was a little cold and bland for the price. The staff were quite friendly and inoffensive, apart from the guy who insisted on singing as he bussed tables - the same line, over and over, badly sung too - however the room's heater didn't work and given the temperature outside, it would have been nice to have a warmer room. Only stayed one night and would recommend this option for those with enough cash - but I'll be staying somewhere a little more economical on my next trip North.

Reviews.Title: “Good valuem, near restaurants and Stanley Park.”
Reviews.Author: LeprechaunBoise
Reviews.Content: A little tired but clean and close to everything, including the water, Stanley Park, trolley line, nearby restaurants and short walk to good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Syliva is the best!”
Reviews.Author: arachne
Reviews.Content: This is probably our fifth stay at the Sylvia over the past twenty years, a 1912-vintage apartment hotel right on English Bay. The outside walls are stone, covered with Virginia Creeper, very European, as Vancouver itself is, really. Leafy neighborhoods, lots of dogs and squirrels,( and even a family of four racoons!), fun for walking, right on Stanley Park and near downtown. No car required. Sylvia has quiet, spacious rooms, most with kitchens, some with fabulous views of the harbour, good beds, attentive, unobtrusive housekeepers, hot water, great room service from the good kitchen, nice bar for drinks. And the rates are very reasonable. It's even dog-friendly, though we come by train this time.

Reviews.Title: “Back for the 4th time”
Reviews.Author: MLFL
Reviews.Content: Apparently you can't go wrong staying at the Sylvia. I was there for 6 days and, again, concluded that it is one of the best cost/benefit ratios in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Pathcontrolmonk
Reviews.Content: What the hotel lacks in modern amenities in makes up for in charm. Friendly, helpful staff and probably the best location in the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: Hollandtraveller
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights during our summer trip to British Columbia. This is a family hotel with a lot of charm. The staff was very friendly and super helpful. Our room was clean and spacious, although it was not above the tree line so we did not have much of a view.
