I suggest asking for a room on a higher floor to have a view of the Bay. What we loved the most about this hotel was its location. It is right outside Stanley Park and has a great view over the English Bay. There's a bike rental shop some blocks away and it's quite easy to rent bikes and go for a tour of Stanley Park and other parts of downtown Vancouver. There are also lots of shops, cafes and restaurants close by. We really enjoyed watching the sunsets over the English Bay while sipping wine on the hotel terrace. We had dinner one evening on the hotel terrace and the food was quite good. Breakfast at the hotel was fine, nothing exceptional. We would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and good value”
Reviews.Author: HerodotusWilts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the sea front at English Bay, not downtown but plenty of action and places to eat nearby, good strolling into Stanley Park and around the bay and walkable to Canada Place etc. The atmosphere is very pleasant, rooms clean and comfortable (you could be lucky enough to get a sea view), and there is a reasonably priced restaurant and bar overlooking the bay. Only fault was - no coffee & tea making facilities in the room, which we found in all other Canadian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Barton Fink hotel”
Reviews.Author: newman24
Reviews.Content: If you've seen the Cohen Bros. movie, you know what I mean. As a travel writer, I know the difference between shabby chic and just plain shabby. This is shabby, and really overpriced. Left after one long, sleepless night (crying in adjacent room, they probably booked two nights). For $30 more, moved to the Westin and saved our trip.

Reviews.Title: “room(s) with a view”
Reviews.Author: sibartz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right at English Beach and next to Stanley Park. We got a suite - the last available rooms- with two rooms and a kitchen, windows facing the sea. It was spectacular, but it all cost something... The rooms were clean and spacious. There is a garage, but we had to pay 15 dollars to park our car. The athmosphere was very friendly. Unfortunately we didn't try the restaurant, it looked good, but we'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Eurofolk
Reviews.Content: As others have signalled this is not the most modern hotel, yet a slightly run down feel to the carpets and corridors (one lift out of order during our stay) did not stop this being a nice, friendly place to do an overnight before travelling to Vancouver Island the following day. Check in staff make you feel welcome and food was fine. 25 minute drive to Departure Bay ferry to Vancouver Island, which was perfect as we needed to get to the Ferry by 7.45 for the 8.30 departure. Note that breakfast only starts at 7.30, but plenty of places to pick up coffee and muffins within walking distance. Rooms were ok - my wife and one son were in the wing where rooms are slightly more modern, while I and my other son were in a two bedroom family room. Was surprised to find no airco in the room, which meant leaving window slight open - however, very quiet so no problem. Great location. We went for a long walk along the beach and walk to see the harbour and the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “great for the location”
Reviews.Author: onechameleon
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on trip adivesor we knew the hotel was old certain comforts would not be available. For the most, we had a great stay. As we were a group having a reunion we wanted our rooms clustered together so as not to disturb others. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms although basic to say the least, were clean. This is not an inexpensive place to stay, with taxes and other fees travelers are looking at over 200.00 per night for double accomodations, and there are no frills! I cannot remember the last time I stayed in a hotel that did not offer a bar fridge, or complimentary coffee maker. While the bathroom did have a hair dryer, the toiletries consisted of hand soap and some body/hair wash in a wall mounted soap dispenser. The beds were not the most comfortable and being that we were located across from one elevator and beside another, we were thankful to have packed our earplugs. I must be clear, you are paying for the location. Right across from the beach, walking distance to some fabulous restaurants beautiful parks, and easy acsess to Granville Island.. For location, this is top drawer.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ferrri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of a Vancouver local. The location is great - overlooking English Bay. There were plenty of eating places nearby. We ate in the hotel bar the first night and the food was simple, well presented and tasty. The only negatives were that the hallway outside our room was a bit musty smelling - but I understand that many buildings in Vancouver have a problem with dampness which is probably the reason for this. Our room however didn't suffer from this problem. The other problem was the showerhead. It appeared to be of the water-saving type and you almost had to run around in the shower to get wet. However, despite these two small issues I would thoroughly recommend the hotel. As a momento I bought the two charming chidren's books that were written about a stray cat who took up residence at the Sylivia Hotel. It will give me great pleasure to recall our short stay here while reading the books to my grandson.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kafoege
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia is classic! An excellent location on English Bay in the heart of Vancouver. We stayed there during the fireworks show and couldn't have asked for a more convenient hotel. If you are looking for flat screen TV's and top of the line bath toiletries, this is not the place for you. Rooms were very clean, but small by modern standards. Being from the Southeastern US, I am used to AC but just open the windows for a nice evening breeze. The staff was wonderful and it was an overall great experience. I will definitely stay there when I visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, especially for Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: twinmommaAlberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with 3 kids ages 6,6,4 for the fireworks. We were in a room with 2 queen beds and a twin bed that was in a separate room I found this hotel to be clean. The bathroom had updated fixtures and the shower worked well and had good pressure. There was always warm water. The rooms maintain the old feeling while being updated. I didn't like that there was no air conditioning, or a bar fridge in the room. Also the windows had no bars on them, but they opened. I thought that was a bit of a safety issue but if you didn't have small kids it wouldn't be an issue. This is directly across from English Bay where the Fireworks were. It was super convenient and we didn't have to deal with the crowds at the end of the night. This hotel is in a super area with lots of restaurants and you can easily spend a day at the beach looking for crabs or just chilling out.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, horrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: Scubasteve0011
Reviews.Content: No a/c, non functional showers, overpriced, unclean. Stay somewhere else!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a few steps to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: 07272010r
Reviews.Content: Nice old fashioned hotel with character. Clean and has a great view patio. Good food.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, amazing staff and rooms with lots of space. What a great place for a family to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Konrad-Family
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with young kids or teens, want a central Vancouver location, love a bit of old-world charm over sleek and modern and like friendly staff, then you will be thrilled if you pick the Sylvia. When you travel with a crew, space is so critical, and we did not feel crowded in the least. My three kids enjoyed the family suite we had so much that they just wanted to hang out; we had to force them out to do the tourist stuff. And we appreciated the flexibility in being able to add a night to our stay. At breakfast we had amazing views over English Bay, and my wife says the tea that came in the carafe was the hottest and best restaurant tea she has had in years. Fantastic. And we sat in the lounge at night and enjoyed the view some more. Really, who could ask for a better location. Except for the Capilano Suspension Bridge we hardly used our car. We walked, bussed downtown etc. And the front desk staff were great. When we needed to find something, the local maps came out and got marked to help us do our thing. Everyone was so helpful. To the Sylvia, thanks for the great stay and we look forward to staying again on our next trip out to visit family.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great, the hotel is NOT”
Reviews.Author: nacyr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the proximity of Stanley Park, but the hotel was certainly a disapointment. The room was very small, the bathroom very old and I had to stand on the edge of the bathtub to turn on the light fixture over the vanity. We couldn't hook up to the "free" internet service and when I took my laptop down to the reception desk they insisted that the problem was the laptop, yet a few days earlier we had stayed at the Blue Horizon and had no problem at all. While I was there, another guest came by the desk and said that he also was unable to connect and also had stayed at the Blue Horizon and had no trouble connecting. When we went to the restaurant downstairs for breakfast we waited for about 1/2 hour to even get acknowledged and that was after I asked 2 servers if we could order. The beginning of the week we had stayed at the Blue Horizon, which was less money and was far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, the look and the location!”
Reviews.Author: monicarichards
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The kids were taken with the whole cat story as well as it's location close to the beach. Even though it was cold, they played on it every night. We liked how close it was to Denham street where all the restaurants are, as well as Stanley Park. We walked all over Vancouver from here. The only thing I would change if I could change anything is that the rooms are on the small side, but that's to be expected with a historic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Something of an institution”
Reviews.Author: Maxtravel50
Reviews.Content: I chose this place on basis of trip advisor reports. Some of the reviews mentioned it was dowdy. I thought funky! Other reviews complained about having to use staircase. Sylvia's staircase runs through middle of hotel, and so wonderfully convenient for those of us who relish use of stairs in hotels. I was surprised to have a yappying dog in room next door (where I come from it is virtually unheard of to allow dogs in hotels). But management were sympathetic and moved me to swanky suite on upper floor. So can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and historic charm!”
Reviews.Author: KaT95682
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed the one night we spent at the Sylvia Hotel. We received a free upgrade and the room we had, while not spacious by modern hotel standards, was adequate with a comfortable king bed and freshly painted walls. The bathroom seemed a bit outdated, but otherwise the amenities were excellent and we had a view of the quiet inner driveway off the main street. Service at check-in and check-out was pleasant. Normal check-out time is noon but we were leaving for a cruise and the staff granted our request for a later check-out at 1PM. The best thing about the hotel is the location! You can walk to Stanley Park and are just steps away from English Bay. You are also just a block away from Denman Street which has lots of great restaurants (highly recommend Acacia Fillo Bar for some stellar Bulgarian food--a highlight of our trip!) While some parts of the hotel (like the slow elevators and shabby hallways) are showing its age, overall this was well worth it price-wise compared to other downtown hotels. (If you're a cat lover, be sure to check out the darling artwork in the lobby depicting "Mr. Got to Go" the now-famous stray cat who decided to make the hotel his home some years ago. So cute!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great location, but old”
Reviews.Author: Rick54R
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The hotel has a lot of charm. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was OK - but it just needed a touch of new - new towels at least, and updated furniture. Good value. Loved sitting in the restaurant and enjoying the English Bay views.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: MLFL
Reviews.Content: Third time at the Sylvia. No surprises. Good value for your maney. The staff is always very helpful, the restaurant is good and the bar is great with the big windows facing English Bay. I would, however, suggest painting the corridors in a lighter shade of yellow and with NO textures. Carpet in some corridors also need changing. Stayed in one of the newer rooms (over the parking). Great rooms, good space.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION AND QUIET, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: loverofmilan
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Sylvia after visiting family on Pender Island. PROS : Excellent location Very quiet (reason for choosing hotel) Comfortable bed CONS: Athough I knew the hotel was old prior to arriving, somehow it still was not what I was expecting - My room : Side sea view and opposite an apartment block Could not do anything without closing curtains - i.e. no privacy, no net curtains, therefore dark. Walk in wardrobe - no light - could not see a thing No coffee/tea making facilities No fridge Toiletries : 1 bar of soap No chair for desk 2 miniscule bath towels Lift One worked okay The other permanently reflected it was going to the 5th floor, but it always got me to the 6th floor (somehow) Passageways Old and let's say "not nice" - would rather forget what they look like Reception Old, but okay Staff were pleasant enough Restaurant Ok All in all, I thought I would stay there again on a similar type of trip due to the amazing location and quiet at night, but after checking into an Airport Hotel in Frankfurt for a few hours, due to a 13 hour layover and found myself in a bright, clean modern room, I do not think I would stay at the Sylvia again. I do not want to say the Sylvia is a dump as the state of the hotel is apparently "the charm of it", but I do not feel there was enough to call me back. Who knows? Different strokes for different folks.

Reviews.Title: “A secret I'd prefer to keep to only close friends.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: If you want to truly experience Vancouver and you like walking along west coast Canadian cedar trails ourside your door, for as long as you like along a historic Pacific Ocean seawall of hand built granite or perhaps wander the increasingly cosmopolitan streets of the West End where you hear perhaps at least 3 languages in one block, then you should try the Sylvia Hotel. I haven't even mentioned the pacific sunsets, the sounds of the gulls and the rain (this is Vancouver!) and a location that branches out in minutes to everywhere in Vancouver. This historic hotel is old and if you can't handle old, go elsewhere. The rooms are all completely individual and, over they years, you may develop your favourites. The staff are not trained robots and can vary from shift to shift, but the management is excellent now and will respond, as they did for me, in an exemplary manner. The Sylvia can be a home away from home, dogs included. I hate to let you in on this secret spot but, judging from the difficulty now in getting reservations, it is secret no more. I only wish I knew of the "other Sylvia's" hidden in more international cities.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with Great Value”
Reviews.Author: iwonttell
Reviews.Content: Love the feel of the hotel. Charming and Historical while at the same time clean and not at all dated. We booked a room based on a recommendation and checked in 5 min later. The had given us a free room upgrade with a partial sea view and free parking as well. Service was decent, not exceeding expectations, but fully meeting them. Ordered breakfast and it came lukewarm and without the juice but we didn't feel the need to complain about it. Sleep was great, and if in that area of Vancouver will be back to it I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on English Bay”
Reviews.Author: jonesm99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sylvia for a month in February and was very pleased with the hotel. The staff are great and the view of English Bay at sunset is amazing. They really made me feel at home knowing that I would be there for such an extended stay. While I was there they upgraded the bedding and the televisions in the rooms to make it a little more modern. I would suggest asking for a corner suite that wraps around the side of the building, the view is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay - a must if you're in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: site16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the real thing. Very authentic experience staying here. The staff were wonderful and I just didn't want to leave at the end of my trip. The location is perfect..close to downtown, but right at the shore of English Bay (stunning views!) and Stanley Park. I'll make a point to stay here every time I'm in Vancouver. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice 1909 hotel overlooking English Bay”
Reviews.Author: Michparis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at Sylvia Hotel, this time we wanted to train up from Seattle before the Olympic Games, so we were fortunate to finally be able to rent a fully furnished suite, room 622 with kitchen and all five windows overlooking the Pacific. To the right, 150 meters, Stanley Park, to the left, Davie street and easy walk to downtown or the trail along the shore to catch a mini Seabus to Granville Island. A very affordable and welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront location walking distance to all of West End of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tenayaca
Reviews.Content: This is an older brick hotel with GREAT charm. Elevators are small but working and fast. VERY pet friendly with many people bringing their best friends over the Christmas holiday. Staff is friendly and helpful. We hope to go back to this one again. It's walking distance to Stanley Park (southwest end) and is just across the street from the beach walkway. FINE restaurants are closeby -- Raincity Grill -- 1 block (reservations recommended). Also, if you're booking over the holidays and want to eat IN the hotel restaurant at any time, MAKE RESERVATIONS. That was one thing we cannot comment on, because we didn't get in for the brunch. We had a kitchenette suite which was really well stocked with equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Hotel, Not Fancy Schmancy, but real value!”
Reviews.Author: Bluesman123
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the Sylvia for 30 years now. I suppose that slants my review a bit. Yes, it can be a little funky, but the staff and the location (in my humble opinion) more than make up for it. Yes it needs a bit of paint. Yes things are a bit nicked here and there. But in terms of staff friendliness and location it is unbeatable. ...and as a plus (for some of us at least) it has a truly remarkable selection of scotch whiskeys in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service!”
Reviews.Author: SanfranciscoCaroline
Reviews.Content: We spoke to the front desk about the mattress being uncomfortably soft- they offered to move us and then surprised us with a brand new mattress THAT DAY. Friendly, fun old hotel, perfect location. Rent bikes from the place recommended at the front desk- they have discount coupons. We biked to Granville island and it was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Boutique”
Reviews.Author: KruzQween
Reviews.Content: On suggestions from two friends and carefully critiquing reviews here on TA, we (my fella, a cruise buddy and I) booked two nights at The Sylvia. We were aware that there may be some issues with carpeting or nicks of paint off the walls, as this is an old hotel. We were delighted with our one bedroom suite (room722). We particularly asked for a bay view room when booking. It was a corner room with windows overlooking the English Bay. The ventilation from the open windows was wonderful. Our suite had one bedroom, a living-dining room, a small kitchen and a bathroom. The kitchen had a sink, stove, microwave, refrigerator, china, glasses, coffeemaker, teapot and utensils for 4 people. You can request an ice bucket at reception and get ice on the first floor. We walked to the 7-11 and Safeway to get coffee, fruit and rolls for breakfast. The bathroom was basic and had bar soap and a shower dispenser of shampoo-conditioner-bath gel. The lobby staff was extremely helpful and likable. We did eat the nachos in the bar and would not order them again as they were nacho chips and all the fixings served in an edible bowl. Either the nachos or the edible bowl would have been enough. That’s the only food we purchased at the hotel. Loved the bar view over the bay. A friend drove up to visit us for the day and did not have to pay to park during the day in the underground parking lot. The location was great and we enjoyed a walk along the seawall on a glorious sunny morning. The only negative was I could not get wireless internet to work in our room.

Reviews.Title: “backpackers would rate this good”
Reviews.Author: fuzzflyer
Reviews.Content: room was ok with stained carpets , miniature old tv ( probably an early Gas version!) shower went from Hot to cold automatically..cool? no coffee or hot water in the room( most 1 Star have this) no fridge of course.... We were unlucky to have a room sin sea view, looking onto the noisy garage and garbage area, unlike the lovely sea view talked about often in the web site... The entrance was "interesting", often we have found lobbies spotless only to find the rest of the hotel grubby... not here.. stained worn carpet with dim lighting and steep steps for carrying our luggage up! and down! The hotel looks very nice on arrival, is very old .... the carpet may be original!! Nice bar, breakfast was ok... overly watered down fruit juice and poached egg without toast is possibly a Canadian thing but a first for us. 5 out of 10 at the price ,big cities just get away with it..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: LeoAlberta
Reviews.Content: We finally stayed at the Sylvia for 2 nights in September after intending to try it for a long time. We have stayed in several other hotels in the area. We have also stayed at several other vintage hotels in our travels. While the location is unsurpassed we were generally disappointed. The major problem was that one of the two elevators broke on the second day of our stay. Since we were on the sixth floor, we decided to wait for the other elevator. When we finally got on, it was packed and then failed to open on its first stop. An employee also on the elevator couldn't get the elevator to open or the elevator to move and finally another gentleman was able to pry open the door. It was a scary experience. Needless to say we walked up and down the six flights of stairs for the last day of our visit since the one elevator was still not fixed and we didn't trust the other(and it was busy). Besides this we felt it was not a good value. Lightbulbs were burned out, there was a loose tile in the bathroom and there were not toiletries besides bars of soap. There are other properties of similar price such as the Coast Hotel or the Sunset Inn and Suites which deliver far better value if a little less charm.

Reviews.Title: “Old Timey Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgl1
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia's service was just fine. Our room with a view over the parking area was large and in definite need of a remodel - floor stained, bits of the bathroom falling apart, and the room could have used a couch or a couple of comfortable chairs. But it was a good enough location. I know people who have stayed there have loved it and have gone there for years (my travel companion for one), but I was less than totally impressed. Perhaps in better weather...it was raining to entire time so the location was not as important as it might be.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel...but no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCrazyhair
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers, this is a quaint, charming hotel with a great location and friendly, helpful staff. If you want a cookie-cutter, modern luxury hotel - this isn't the place! The rooms are nice (ours was large), a bit in need of a remodel - but if you are staying at the hotel during warm weather...beware, the rooms don't have any air conditioning and they get very very warm (luckily they cool down in the evenings)!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, very friendly, very Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 2006Oz
Reviews.Content: We were a party of six & we spent 3 + 1 nights at the Sylvia on the recommendation of a friend who knows Vancouver well. On our first visit we all had rooms overlooking English Bay, not quite as good as it sounds since dense trees along the sea front obscure much of the view but you still get the atmosphere. The rooms are a bit old-fashioned but that is part of the charm - after rushing around for two weeks & staying at some anonymous so-called luxury hotels my wife sank into the armchair & said it's just like home! On our return visit we stayed in the new wing - nice room but a bit ordinary. Good bar & coffee shop/ terrace. It's a great location, next to the sea, an easy walk up to the lido & Stanley Park & down to the ferry for Granville Market. Easy to get to Robson St for shopping or bike hire. Friendly & efficient staff, e.g. looking puzzled & annoyed in the foyer, a voice from reception said "your wife's in the bar" - sorted! If you don't want the hotel breakfast there are lots of coffee bars very close. The Vancouver style is so laid-back as to be almost embalmed - the Sylvia is just short of that, relaxed but efficient. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Fashpo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite at the Sylvia for 4 nights and absolutely loved it. Service was fantastic with no "airs" about it, the rooms suited our needs so well, that we completely packed out for our stay with clothes in the ample closets and dressers. We ate at the restaurant numerous times (great burgers!), had a nice steak via room service and breakfast the day of our departure. The kitchen was fully functional and had room for seating for three. The only minuses were that the sofabed could have been a bit more comfortable and that the windows reminded my husband so much of the opening scene from von Trier's "Antichrist" that he was constantly checking to make sure that they were locked so that our 3-year old son wouldn't decide to crawl out of an open window. We were in Vancouver on one of the hottest days of the year (so far) and despite the windows being hermetically sealed by paranoid husband and no airconditioning, our rooms were never uncomfortably hot. Parking was really easy (underground lot beside the hotel with 15 minute loading bays by the reception) and reasonably priced ($10 night). A quick walk across the street and you're right on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unique non-chain hotel & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chismb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sylvia for 4 nights at the start of a 3 week holiday in BC with our teenage sons. We had a suite of two rooms next to each other with a separate door off the corridor which we could lock to give us private access to the two rooms. Both were very clean, well furnished and quiet. It was clear that the hotel was very old (1912 I belive) as there were signs of many changes and alterations. The main room had a well equipped kitchen and lounge, and of course for teenagers free wi-fi was a must. We tried the room service one night & that was rapid and friendly. We also ate in the hotel a couple of nights, the restaurant was fine, but not a huge menu. Breakfasts were always great. Nearby we tried the Rain City Bar & grill - very nice but pricy and too nouveau cuisine for us. Things we enjoyed doing: * hiring bikes & riding round Stanley Park, * acquarium in Stanley Park * open top bus tour

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Matched Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Igettaround
Reviews.Content: We expected rustic not luxurious. We expected windows with natural light and great views, not contemporary coverings. We expected a bar/lounge where we could drink, relax and look out at English Bay, not big screen tvs and 5-star foods. We expected the kitchen to have everything we'd need, and didn't think twice about the formica countertops. We most enjoyed the proximity to the beach, to Stanley Park, and the history of the old place. The furnishings are terribly dated but the low maintenance budget keeps the prices down, and we felt fortunate to have spent time at the Sylvia. Only disappointment: coffee should have been provided for in-room, personal use. Not a big expense but would make a big difference to travelers. ps: Spend the money . . upgrade to a larger room!

Reviews.Title: “Our Canadian travel ritual”
Reviews.Author: WilmaHarris
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Syliva for that last 12 years - we always go at the start of our Candadian trip and the end - great for winding down from work and long flight before heading out on our adventures. We love the whole set up - its like home from home - staff have come and gone but we are always welcomed back like old friends. We are never treated any different if we turn up with our backpacks on - or with our expensive looking luggage. On occasions we have filled our room with our camping gear and have received help to pack away and load up! One year I was hospitalized elsewhere in Canada and on coming out out the hotel went out of their way to find room for us to wait a few days until a suitable flight home could be found -even in height of summer at their most fullest! I cannot speak highly enough of the owners and staff of this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CUPBOARD-SIZE ROOM BUT I'D STILL GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: go9ers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position looking out over English Bay. We had excellent weather with a sunset so the view was great. Shops and restaurants are minutes away. Our room was not much biger than the bed and two people would never get in the bathroom, and only a midget would fit in the bath. We were there for only one night so it wasn't a big deal but I would try to get a bigger room for a longer stay. Best thing for our short stay was the bar area. Really lively on a Friday evening with friendly staff and a great atmosphere, if a bit pricey compared to outside.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AriaDream
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia was a wonderful place to stay. The rooms were a bit basic but BIG and we had a second small room with a bed! That was perfect when a friend needed to stay with us for a night. The restaurant was lovely, they allow dogs and the location is very convenient to many other areas. And the price, while much higher than 87 dollars... where does that come from?... was still right. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “basic room, great location”
Reviews.Author: AZORWA
Reviews.Content: We were a group of two couples who traveled to Vancouver BC to see the sights. Pros: The Sylvia Hotel was easy to find and check in was a breeze. The lobby was very warm and inviting. Parking in the attached garage is $10 CDN per night, which we thought was a great deal. Our "Large 2 Queen Room" was indeed large. The cocktails in the lobby bar were delicious and reasonably priced. Front desk staff were helpful when asked but not overly friendly. Location! Right on English Bay and only 1-2 blocks from Denham Street. We walked everywhere. Cons: The room is very basic, the walls are quite thin and the linens were of moderately low quality. The bar/restaurant had poor service and stopped serving food well before the published time. We had just arrived at 9:30 and the sign said they serve on weekends until 11:30. That meant room service was not available either (the info in the room said we could order until 10:45).

Reviews.Title: “Characterful with a fantastic position”
Reviews.Author: goudhurstgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Sylvia for four nights on either side of a ski trip to Whistler. Had a family room with two bedrooms-furniture was a bit basic, but comfortable and large. Bathroom was on the tiny size-but on our return stay we had identical rooms two floors down and this room was much smarter with a larger bathroom. I think this is part of the charm-all the rooms are different. The staff were very helpful and friendly although on our last morning we waited AGES to be served our breakfasts!. Ate in the restaurant a few times- good food and value for money. Bar was very attractive and a brillian view of English Bay day and night. Room service was very good and efficient (perfect when you're jet lagged)-and also essential as there is no fridge or coffee in the rooms.(Ice machine in the lobby though). I think this is probably the best position for a hotel in this great city-Stanley Park is a must and ther are fantastic places to eat-try Bridges in Granville Island and the fish restaurant in Stanley Park. We would stay here again-the rooms could do with a facelift, but I think they vary in size and quality. A brilliant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Old World”
Reviews.Author: 1KayakBC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas 2008. Hotel is located direct on English Bay. It is in easy strolling distance of Stanley Park and the Non Chain retaurants and stores on Denman St. The hotel is old. This adds to its charm. Rooms are basic but have everything you need, except coffee. Coffee is available from the restaurant or the numerous coffee shops on Denman. The bar area is excellent. On cold, rainy, windy, or any other day I suppose you can sit there and have coffee or more, be warm and look out a life going by. Only had breakfast in the restaurant - It was good. Do feed the pigeons on the beach. Do visit Stanley park and take some food for the ducks - there is a pet food store just up the road. This part of town is where the locals come to relax and unwind. If you have to visit a city but would prefer to be outdoors, this is the hotel for you. If you must have the shiny stuff, the designer soap in the shower, a wet bar in your room, crowds of people rushing around then it may not be what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel - could be a gem”
Reviews.Author: Kateguide
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year as my sister was getting married there. The best point about this hotel is the location - right next to Stanley Park and Denman Street; the views over English Bay are breath-taking. Vancouver city centre is pretty small so we were able to walk everywhere. The food and the drinks were pretty good although on the pricy side relative to the immediate competition. The decor in the communal areas were fine. The decor in the corridors & rooms needed to be updated - very 70s. There are no tea & coffee making facilities in the room which was quite annoying after a few days. As there were a few of us in our party, we had rooms across the price range - it's worth trying to go for a more expensive option as the cheapest rooms were pokey.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch Value”
Reviews.Author: kckar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in what appeared to be the "newer" block of rooms in the building above the parking garage. We didn’t have a postcard view, but had lots of light with large windows looking out onto the neighborhood street. The room was exactly what I would expect for the price and a bit more. Clean room, and no "out-dated" furnishings by my standard (as other reviewers have mentioned). If you come to Vancouver to watch TV on a big screen in your room, or insist on having a mini-fridge and coffee pot, you will be disappointed. That was not a consideration for us. Great lobby and a perfect restaurant and bar, with a quality breakfast. Friendly service and cleaning staff. Unbeatable location. And parking for $10 a night!!?? You gotta be kidding me. That's a steal compared to other places. I was honestly expecting a so-so experience from all of the reader reviews. I have stayed at many, many different hotels in downtown Vancouver, some of them very nice, and this was hands down the best deal I have ever gotten, without going through a discount site. Given the location, it even competes with a lot of the older deals you used to be able to get on those websites. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ashimarob
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Sylvia. Rooms are small and a bit utilitarian but ours had a great beach view and the lobby of the hotel is very inviting. The location is great, lots to do, see and eat around. Staff was friendly. Room was very clean if old-fashioned.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the location”
Reviews.Author: CRMLN
Reviews.Content: I visited the Sylvia for the first time back in the early 80's and loved then and love it still. I guess the best part is because it hasn't change all that much (this could be also be considered a bad thing); it hasn't become a trendy "boutique" hotel, nor is it a generic chain. It's a class of its own. You aren't going to find luxury nor a fantastic decor, but you will find charm and the best location in Vancouver. It feels like you are a part of the city, instead of a deadzone in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charm, Service!”
Reviews.Author: laustic
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three that stayed in one of the 2 bedroom suites (one queen and one single). *Room: Good size, decor is pretty spartan, but nice and tidy. Our room seemed nicer in real life than it looks on the website. It was very nice to have the separate bedroom. Keep in mind that this is an older building so the rooms have quirks. The ceiling had a very odd texture on it (not a big deal, but it did stand out). The bathroom was more notable. When you sit on the toilet your knees literally touch the vanity. Beds were comfortable. *Location: Couldn't be much better in my mind. I suppose some could say that the distance from 'downtown' is a detractor, but we were easily entertained for 3 full days in this part of town. This part of town is very quiet and laid back. Stanley Park is a MUST do and a very short walk to the park entrance. A free shuttle runs around the perimeter of the park through the summer. It's a short (15 min) walk to water taxis for Granville Island. And if you are inclined to head downtown it's a pretty reasonable taxi ride. And if you're lucky enough to have nice weather English Bay beach is lovely! *The food: there is a restaurant/bar in the hotel which is always nice and convenient. The restaurant is pretty decent, but a little overpriced. The cocktails from the bar are nice and well priced. But you shouldn't limit yourself to the hotel. This area is a treasure trove of great local eateries. The sushi can't be beat - ask the front desk for any recommendations. They recommended Tanpopo. It looked a little shady to us, but it was so excellent and affordable that we went 2 nights in a row. This can be an expensive city so it's always nice to find a bargain. Or just stroll up and down Denman (don't miss the gelato and cupcakes!) *The service: always excellent. It seemed like most of the front desk staff were young college age kids (probably interns), but they were always extremely helpful, polite and professional. There is a laptop with free internet access in the lobby, but it was almost always in use and excruciatingly slow - not a huge problem for us since we were there to unplug. I highly recommend the Sylvia for anyone looking for a charming quite hotel and a great bargain in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Stroll back into the past”
Reviews.Author: AdaTheAlien
Reviews.Content: We just chose the Sylvia for a 30 year reunion of friends from California, London and Chicago. The staff could not have been more helpful with the pre-arrival arrangements (which kept changing). When we first arrived I was worried about the hotel I had chosen: the corridors seemed poorly lit and the decor old and faded. You need to stay more than one night to fall for this hotel's charms. The staff were infinitely pleasant and helpful. The late night barman and the breakfast waiters were great. Having a martini in an art deco bar is not something you can do everywhere. We had a whole range of rooms; from a small queen to a very large suite and all were really good value for money. The location could not be beaten with the beach right opposite and two of Vancouver's best restaurants 1-2 blocks away (Fish House Stanley Park and Rain City Grill; also Tampopo for sushi). It was lovely to be in a real neighbourhood, yet anywhere else we wanted to go was readily accessible by public transport or cab. This is not a bland faceless chain hotel: there are plenty of those in the city. If you want something a bit different that you'll remember for ever, that is really good value for money, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Querky but get over your initial reactionto the decor in the rooms and...”
Reviews.Author: dmjnr
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the elegant and clean decor of the restaurant and bar, or the cosy reception area and helpful staff. Once you get to your room you will find outdated, shabby decor, dis-functional room layouts and some serious doubts about whether to stay or not. Get over them. The Sylvia hotel is one of those hotels you would love to restore to it's former glory with style and features which you know are in there but you just cant dig them out. What the Sylvia has is a great location - just over from the beach and a minute or so walk from Stanly park. Our party had 3 rooms each with their own querkyness. In one you could not stand up at the toilet because the sink unit was behind you. (great for the traveling businessman because they can sit their laptop on the vanity unit and work while sitting on the toilet). In another the windows would not stay open and slammed down (luckily not on anyone's fingers). One room consisted of a small single room plus 2 doubles in the adjacent room which would have been better knocked into one large room to allow for space. In a third there was a kitchen and separate lounge which also had a lack of anything to use in the kitchen. Towel sets seem to be given out sparingly as both rooms with 4 people only ever got 2 or 3 sets of towels. During our stay new furniture arrived in our rooms daily, firstly coffee tables, then chairs, then the pictures all got replaced. It became fun to guess what would be replaced next and I still wonder if this is part of the weekly entertainment at the Sylvia but I assume it is an attempt at updating. It would be better to spend some time decorating rather than changing the furniture. So if you are the type who likes clean modern hotels or elegant old world hotels then then this is not for you. But if you have a sense of humor, treat the hotel as a place to sleep rather than a home away from home, have a sense of adventure and want to be near the beach then this may well be the place for you. I saw many happy faces during my stay which is more than I can say for some hotels. PS Everyone who stays at the Sylvia for more than a few days learns that the older lif sometimes gets stuck before the door closes but a swift nudge on the sensor strip down the edge soon gets it goiung again. PPS Watch for the racoons on the vines...

Reviews.Title: “cheery and funky”
Reviews.Author: winston_7
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia is either to your taste or not. Glitzy it's not. The decor is distinctly anti-modern and rooms and hallways exude a well worn comfort. But the rooms are also large and bright, the housekeeping just fine, the views can be excellent, and the location, on the fringe of downtown but nestled up against English Bay, fabulous. The lobby is a friendly circus. The breakfasts are very good, provided you avoid the continental one. We would go again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Sylvia is Back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingScholar60
Reviews.Content: It's clear from some reviews in the past few months that the Sylvia was going through some tough times as this old hotel remodeled the lobby--several reviews express frustration and anger with the noise, rudeness of staff, inconvenience, and shoddiness of the rooms. I read these reviews just weeks before my stay at the Sylvia, and I was braced for an unpleasant experience. I'm happy to report, however, that, if the old and much-loved Sylvia was gone for awhile, it's now back. The bar, with large windows overlooking beautiful English Bay, was lively and cozy and comfortable, with amazingly friendly service. Breakfast at the equally pleasant hotel restaurant was reasonable, well-prepared, and nicely served, and, again, the views of Stanley Bay in the morning are a great way to wake up. My room was large, spotless, if a bit sparely furnished. The bed was very comfortable. The carpet was in great shape, and the towels, which early reviewers complained were thin and stiff, were in fact just fine. I was on the second floor, looking out onto the street, and the room was quite quiet. The lobby is now very pleasant and handsomely refurbished. I found the staff warm and helpful. It's an old hotel, and it shows its age (it has never been fully remodeled), but it exudes warmth and comfort and tradition. As everyone says, its location is unmatched--you are across the street from the seawall, on which you can walk endless miles either way for views you'll never forget, and you're around the corner from one of the two liveliest and busiest and restaurant-filled streets in Vancouver. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Maybe I feel so positive about my stay because my expectations had been so lowered by the reviews I read on this site, but I have to say that I couldn't have been happier during my three days there.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobness
Reviews.Content: Shabby chic indeed. The Grand Dame of Vancouver hotels is a super "retro" place to stay, but not if you are used to chains, as it is, erm, individual, shall we say. I loved it. My 2 female travelling companions less so. The downstairs bar is a wonderful place to wile away an hour or two. Allegedely the only major hotel in Vancouver still to use actual keys for the rooms. I'd go again, location is superb, and you can feel the history.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: a den of theives, literally”
Reviews.Author: AverageAcademic
Reviews.Content: This appears, on first glance, to be a perfectly charming, slightly run-down boutique hotel. It is that--but it is also a place where, in broad daylight and in the space of five minutes as I was checking out, a thief managed to slip through the small and sparsely populated "cozy" little check-in area and swipe my iMac from the spot where I had placed it, not five feet behind me and leaning against my suitcase, in full view of the desk clerk. I'm an experienced traveler--not paranoid, but careful. There was only one other person sitting on a sofa, somewhere behind me. The desk clerk should have seen everything, but claimed not to have. You may imagine my shock. It turns out that Vancouver, although possessing a low violent crime rate, has a staggeringly high petty theft rate due to the preponderance of junkies. In any case, my trip--and year--were ruined by my brief stay at this thieve's nest. Management was unhelpful and of course denied any liability. There was no signage warning guests about the possibility of theft. I found out later that the lobby of the Sylvia is a known pass-through for thieves with precisely this sort of errand in mind. Appearances can be deceiving. I can't tell you not to stay here; I can warn you that you should assume that every single piece of luggage you bring with you is up for grabs the moment you set it down anywhere in the lobby. If that appeals to you...well, be my guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but nothing else spectacular”
Reviews.Author: queenices
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia Hotel A group of 4 of us stayed at the Sylvia 5-8 October 2007 in Room #711. The hotel is a historic landmark in Vancouver and is situated right on English Bay and adjacent to Stanley Park and a main thoroughfare. Depending on the room type you get, there is a nice view of the bay, otherwise you'll get a fair garden view and vistas of the surrounding buildings. The exterior of the building is lovely ivy covered stone that greets you as you head towards it. The interior of the hotel lobby shows that the building is from the early 20th Century, and the lovely marble square staircase reminds you of a bygone era. However, the carpet, as well as the elevators are also of that era, and a bit cramped and slow, but it worked. Once you leave the lobby, you'll be greeted by dank hallways and doors smothered in several layers of old paint. Not very appealing at all. After you enter the room/suite, you'll be a bit more pleased, but not too much. The bathroom is modern, if small, but clean. For those particular about towels, the ones provided are thin and rough, and there aren't much in the way of toiletries. The general decor is slightly outdated and a bit spartan. The suite was spacious enough for all of us for the most part. We had a queen bed with a queen sofa bed suite with kitchen. The kitchen had new appliances that functioned well, and included dishes, utensils, towels and detergent. The kitchen is a convenient alternative to eating all of your meals out, although restaurants are plentiful and reasonably priced near the hotel and around the city. However, I don't recommend the restaurant downstairs. We had breakfast there one morning, and the food did not boast much in the way of taste and the temperature of the meals were tepid at best. Our waitress, while friendly, was a bit clueless and botched our orders, but I have to say the breakfast was average priced. That evening we returned for cocktails, and while the libations were good, the appetizers were wanting again in quality and temperature. We were served by another polite, but brain-dead member of the wait-staff. The front desk staff, were very friendly and eager to help. They made good recommendations and wanted to do what they could to ensure you had a good stay. The furniture (dresser) offered good storage, and the provided ample space. The suite also featured a TV with several channels, and windows that you could easily open and close. The queen bed that I slept in one night, was restful and the linens clean, however, the same can not be said for the sofa bed. It was thin, hard, and completely miserable. The bars that comprised part of the sofa poked through the flimsy mattress. It was impossible to get comfortable and we almost put the mattress on the floor to escape the torture. I was slightly dissapointed, as the photographs on the website, especially of the hallways, show an older and more classic feel, but in reality the hotel is a bit shabby in some respects, and there are several things that can be done to improve the look and feel of the hotel that would still help it to retain the ambiance and preserve the essence of that era. I don't think I will stay here again if I ever returned to Vancouver. It's not a bad place, but for what I paid, it wasn't that great, and there are many other places that can offer more for the same or lower price. The Slyvia's saving grace is, as eveyrone says, "Location ! Location !! Location !!!", and it is really in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PerkyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I want to be fair. The hotel is in a great location, especially if you're gay like me. It's in the gay area of town. If that's your prime criteria then by all means consider the hotel. However, I would not stay at this hotel again. I stayed 11/7/07 through 11/10/07 (today). Please beware! There is major construction on-going on the entire first floor of the hotel. They didn't tell me about it when I made my reservation a month ago. Judging by the enormity of the project you should expect it to be on-going throughout the winter. They moved the lobby out into the foyer and set up some tables to substitute for a front desk. You literally have to wind your way through a maze of scaffolding to get from the "lobby" to the elevators, restaurant, and other exits. Seriously, I'm pretty certain it violates fire codes. There's no way what they set up is safe. Only one person can fit through the maze at a time. If someone is coming the other way with luggage you have to back out to the lobby and wait for them to pass. It may sound minor but it's not. The noise is very loud all day long. They start early in the morning. The walls are thin at this hotel. I wish they had posted this on their web site or at least told me when I made my reservation a month ago. I would have either stayed somewhere else or asked for a discount on the room, which I very much deserved and still do deserve. I was on the 2nd floor right above the construction and it had a hugely negative impact on my stay. I don't really know what others who have posted here mean about the friendly hotel staff. I did not experience that kind of treatment at all. I'm a pleasant enough person. I'm reasonable. The hotel was pretty much empty but they would not move me to another room when I checked in. I know it was empty because they had a board of room keys hanging on the wall behind the check-in table and it was practically full of keys. There were plenty of alternative available rooms. I was perplexed but figured I'd give the room a chance because they called it a "suite." Well, it was pretty awful and calling it a suite is pretty funny. If this room was a suite then all Motel 6 rooms are suites. Please be aware that there are no amenities in the rooms; the floor-board heaters did not work. I asked for them to fix it but they said the repairman wasn't available and I never heard from them again. There is no coffee maker, no mini-fridge, one small 3-draw dresser under the TV, a very old TV with a broken remote control that was obviously purchased from another hotel, a tiny closet, and a window that would only stay open with a wooden slat placed under it to hold it up. I was afraid I might start a fire when I plugged my cell phone charger into the wall because the outlet looked like it had been installed in 1940. The carpet was old and dirty. I gave it the white sock test (walked around for a bit in my socks) and it failed. My socks were dirty. The worst was the mattress! Oh my! I woke up every morning with a back ache and that's not something I normally have problems with. I can sleep on a log, but the mattress was somehow worse than that. They said the bed was a queen-sized! It wasn't! It was a full-size! Hysterically funny that they would think people are that stupid. To get ice, you have to go to the lobby and ask for an ice bucket. There is one ice machine and it's in the "lobby" (foyer). Housekeeping took the ice bucket out of the room everyday. There is one soda machine in the lobby but the only button that worked was diet coke. None of the other drinks were available. There is no snack machine anywhere in the hotel. There's no continental breakfast. No coffee in the lobby (foyer). There's no gift shop/amenities shop and the nearest drug store is a 1/4 mile away. There were only two small glasses in the entire room. That's it - not even plastic cups. They don't use real bath towels. They are those half-size towels that feel like they were washed in sand and dried in an oven. Instead of preserving the architecture of the building, they put in generic drop-ceilings and painted the walls awful colors. It's NOT a boutique hotel or "quaint" as some have posted here. It's a mish-mosh of delapitated construction, path-work fixes, and borrowed furnishings. The very worst part of my experience was last night. I needed to check-in for my flight 24-hours in advance. They have a single PC in the lobby for guest use. They have wireless access throughout the hotel but my laptop isn't wireless enabled (something else they didn't tell me - they just said, "Yes, we have internet access"). Ha. I used (or, attempted to use) the lobby PC 4 times during my stay. It was only working on two of those occasions. Last night when it wasn't working I asked the woman at the foyer check-in table to help me. She came over, tried it, and it wasn't connecting to the internet. She said, "Let me check my PC." (which was 5 feet away) She said, "Mine's working fine." I asked, "Can I use your PC to check-in online?" explaining that I had to do it ASAP to get a good seat on my flight. She wouldn't let me use her PC! I explained to her that I was a guest at the hotel (giving her one last chance to redeem the hotel and my terrible experience) and that I would very much appreciate it if she'd let me use it this one time. She started to tell me why she couldn't do that but I interrupted her and asked if there was an internet cafe nearby. She said, "Sure. Just go around the block..." Well, that was yet another lie. The internet cafe she directed me to was a 1/2 mile walk. At this point my partner and I had had it. So, I'm confused regarding the so-called friendly service others encountered at the hotel. They didn't even smile at us or say hello when we checked in! You may ask why we stayed after the first night. It was a personal decision. We were on vacation and we had plans and tours to take so our time was limited. We didn't want to have to endure the hassle of finding another hotel, packing up our stuff, and going somewhere else. We figured it was just 3 nights. Now, we regret that. We should have left after the first night. I realize some of this sounds harsh. But it's all true. This site is about sharing experiences and mine were not good. When I encounter a great hotel I document it here. Read my other reviews. This post isn't about trashing a hotel. It's about letting others know my experience and hopfully saving someone else from the terrible time we had.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: doraexplora
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sylvia beginning of October for 3 nights. Was a bit wary at first after reading some of the reviews, but it was better than we expected. Although the standard queen room we stayed in was small and basic, it was clean and had all that we required, (tea making things would have been good though). The staff were very helpful and friendly on the desk and in bar/resturant. The best thing though and what made up for anthing that might have been lacking was definately the location. The tour bus stopped at the end of the road, which was good. It was really nice sitting in the restuarant or bar by the window looking out over English Bay. We ate in the hotel on several occasions and our opinion of the food was excellent. After seeing some of the other more expensive hotels located in Vancouver we were pleased we chose the Sylvia, and would probably stay there again, purely for the location, but in a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - disappointing accommodation”
Reviews.Author: dc_irl
Reviews.Content: I had heard the hotel was somewhat of an Institution because of it's history - although it's a very impressive historic building and the location is great, I was very disappointed with the rooms. The decor was very poor and I was especially wary of the bed linen and how clean it was. The rest of the room was clean but in general it had an old feel to it and could definitely do with some updating. We ate in the restaurant every morning and the food was find, however, we ate dinner there one night and It wasn't great. Overall I would say that if location is key, then this is your place but if you like more modern decor, then stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting.”
Reviews.Author: kimbersally
Reviews.Content: The Slyvia is located in a perfect place.... That is the main selling point for this hotel in my opinion. I was disappointed when I saw our room. It was very different than what others have described on this site and I was disappointed. We only stayed one night. We cancelled our reservation for the other two nights. The carpet was very poorly installed and there were large lumps and bunched carpet in multiple areas in our room. The bathroom cabinet was in a terrible state, a corner had been knocked off and then reattached with a two nails (that were not properly hammered in). I had to avoid being scratched everytime I walked past. The toilet was in a small dark corner, and to be honest I felt creeped out the entire time I stayed in our room. It just felt dark and musty. The halls were very dark and creepy as well. It was a wonderful location, but at 175 a night I felt we could do better. We ended up finding another hotel that was also in a good location and did not cost as much....and I did not worry about tripping on the carpet and breaking my neck when I got up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but somehow its OK”
Reviews.Author: Gwelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family of four for three nights. It seemed to fit our needs very well. The room we had was very large, two queens and a pull-out bed. Bathroom small and a large "walk-in" closet. Clean and tidy. The hotels public areas are dated, but somehow its OK! The bar and restaurant is vibrant. The staff very friendly and knowledgeable. My only gripe was the time it took to be seated for breakfast - I counted 8 free tables but we still had to queue up for 10-15mins! Why? Overall, a great location and hotel. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed at the Sylvia!”
Reviews.Author: winepourer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sylvia because we wanted to be near the fireworks. After the show ,which was awesome - it was Spain's night, we just walked across the street to the hotel. The location couldn't be better! Close to Stanley Park, walking distance to the ferry ride which takes you to Granville Island. The ferry also can take you to Yaletown and other sights of Vancouver. Lots of restaurants just around the corner on Denman Street and Davies Street. Walking distance to Robson Street. We used Land/Sea tours and took the train up to Whistler and their bus back. This was a great trip! The hotel was clean, the restaurant good for breakfast or dinner! We made a good choice to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place!”
Reviews.Author: cc41
Reviews.Content: We loved The Sylvia. Rooms are sparse, but comfortable and clean. Front desk staff was awesome, helpful and friendly. The bar is very comfortable. It has a great atmosphere, nice background music (easy to have a conversation), great view, great drink and snack choices and again helpful and friendly staff. Free internet with printer available in the lobby. Reasonable parking rates. Great, great location. The Sylvia is not air conditioned, so we booked a bayside room for the breeze. May not be necessary. We were very comfortable temperature-wise, but it is the noisy side, especially on weekend nights as English Bay Beach is a pretty happening place. It did not keep us awake, but I imagine others could be bothered. If you like interesting, boutique hotels, you'll like the Sylvia. **Hint: Great breakfast at Hilary's Cafe on Denman St. 1 block from the Sylvia, a couple doors down from Starbucks. $15 for 2 Wish we had found it earlier. Also looks like great take-out sandwiches for the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but great location”
Reviews.Author: Kitty44a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 4 nights of our recent holiday, and we really enjoyed it. the hotel is in a fab location - it's a bit of a walk to Downtown, but we were more interested in spending time in Stanley Park and the seawall. The airporter bus also stops nearby. Short walk to Granville Island Ferries and the trolley bus stop is right opposite the hotel. We had a small room on the 1st floor, which was fairly tiny even by English standards, but it was comfortable and clean. The interior decoration is quite dated and will need an overhaul at some point, but if you go expecting it, it's not a problem - just don't expect 5 star luxury here (which for the price you won't be!). Definitely the most reasonably priced place we looked at bar the YWCA, and in a much, much better location. We ate breakfast in the restaurant each morning and it was about £5 a head. Also had dinner there which was lovely. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Dame”
Reviews.Author: Moms-The-Word
Reviews.Content: This hotel qualifies an excellent rating because of location, but rooms are just slightly above average. For street appeal, there is nothing that compares to this older boutique hotel. Sitting in the bar and gazing out over English Bay is a delight in itself. Service was wonderful both in the restaurant and hotel. Clean rooms, but sparse. Some attention to decorative detail could enhance the rooms and would detract from the obvious age of the hotel. Comfortable beds. Towels in bathroom could be thicker (a few more would be nice) and check the plumbing (bath plug didn't work), but bathroom was one of the cleanest I've ever seen. A more up to date area guide book would be nice too. Overall it was pleasant to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Sylvia -not so great this time”
Reviews.Author: gscarton
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with 2 queen beds two months in advance. On arrival we got a suite with one queen bed and a pull out couch. We were told that their changing over all their room to one king size bed and had notified people of the changes, unfortunatly we not called. They offered us a roll away cot "at no charge." We felt this was a fairly significant mistake and an apology was the very least we expected which we did not received at any time. I should add that we had both stayed at the Sylvia in the past and although the hotel is old and shabby they offer the best view of the bay. We will forego the view next time and opt for a hotel that is more concerned about customer service and that offers 2 beds. Not everyone is traveling with a spouse! On a positive note the housekeeping staff are very customer friendly, too bad the cot wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Iplaymydong
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the sylvia hotel after reading the reviews on this site and some others and would have to say my stay there was quite enjoyable. The hotel itself is rather old and it shows in the hallways and decor of the common rooms, however the room i stayed in (511) is clean and suited my needs perfectly. I booked a room with 2 beds 1 single and 1 double. To my suprise the single bed was in a different bedroom which was fine. The sylvia is located across the street from english bay beach and is in walking distance to denman st and robson st so you have plenty to eat and things to shop for. The only problem with the hotel was the walls are paper thin. I was planning to wake up at 10am but was awoken by loud --- opera singing by some lady. Try the cupcakes on denman they're crazy good its a pink shop by starbucks about half a block away, u cant miss it!!

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel on English Bay”
Reviews.Author: prideaux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sylvia Hotel because of its history, its spacious accomodations, and its location in Vancouver's West End. The hotel was built in 1912 to be self-contained apartments and later became a hotel. The front desk staff was excellent, knowledgeable and helpful. We enjoyed our dinner in the bistro adjacent to the restaurant and lounge with a lovely view across English Bay to the lights of Kitsilano and out to UBC. Breakfast was also a delight as we watched the joggers heading to the Stanley Park seawall--even in the freezing weather! We upgraded to a one bedroom suite with a kitchen and sitting room. The foyer of our suite was huge. We had a partial view of the bay from all three rooms. Though the decor and finish was dated, the rooms were very clean and the king size bed comfortable. The extra blanket in the closet was hilariously thread-bare though. I would recommend this hotel for its bygone charm, location, and spacious accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Hospitallity with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Elgar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sylvia Hotel many times over the years from the 1950's. Originally with my Grandfather and thereafter I enjoyed my annual visits: It's about time I contributed a few well chosen comments about this unique hotel located at English Bay. The Sylvia is unique! It is still a private owned hotel with tremendous 'olde world feeling'. I have been fortunate to visit 160 countries throughout the world, the Sylvia has a very special place in my memories. In an ever changing world the Sylvia seems to remain in a 'time warp'.....The rooms are like a visit back in time. They all have the modern amenities that one would expect, however their charm suggests a more sedate age. The hospitallity is obvious as soon as one enters the reception lounge ( check out the old photos on the wall of the hotel pre- First World War): The staff are most friendly and helpful, Huguette, who has been there since Captain George Vancouver Royal Navy sailed into what is now Canada Place is such a courteous and charming lady, its always a pleasure to have a cordial chat and wander down 'memory lane'. The restaurant situated across from English Bay is a delight! The chef has been in situ for ages and always presents a splendid hearty meal. The view from the restaurant for all meals - breakfast through dinner is exceptional. Try dinner at sunset! The location could not be better: a brief walk to Stanley Park, or along Denman and Davie. A trip downtown along Robson Street is a must. The local bus service is frequent and cheap. So I now look forward to my return in April 2007. I suggest you try visiting the Sylvia for an experience you will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haggis_BJ
Reviews.Content: The Sylvia Hotel is a great place to stay in Vancouver. It is on a bay, so great views. We had one of the smaller rooms but we still had a glimpse of the water. Breakfast downstairs in the restaurant had a terific view so a great way to start the day. Sunset was also good, watching people jogging on the beach and walking their dogs. The hotel itself is a gorgeous old building with a lot of character. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Charming....”
Reviews.Author: heatherbennett_123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before with my family, and the sheer convenience of the property's location is worth it's weight in gold. This is not a resort, or a hotel with a spa or pool. The decor is old world, updates to furniture and paint are not a priority at the Sylvia. What is a priority, however, is your comfort and enjoyment of the hotel and the area. The nights I had there with my family in July 2006, (seven of us, including 2 teen boys and Grandma), were amazing. The front desk staff were so kind, and funny, and enjoyable, that we made a point of chatting with them whenever we had a chance. My husband and I had a drink in front of a ceiling to floor window at sunset while gazing out at the seaside. The kids splashed and played at the beach, and my Mum just rested at the waterfront. Anyone with kids knows what an experience it can be to haul all you need down to the beach. Imagine simply crossing a road to get there. The rooms were spotless. The linens INCLUDING the bedspreads were fresh and crisp. The hallways are darker that of your standard Howard Johnsons, and the elevators are older, so they don't come as quickly. But who cares? You're on holidays. No need to rush..... And yes, if you want a bay-side room, be warned, they get snapped up fast. Don't expect to show up in the summer months and get room, either. Suites can go a year in advance, but don't be discouraged, call them up. I booked my trip for July 2007 in September 2006. However, I got a reservation for July 2006 about 2 months prior. I love this hotel, you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: bladzig
Reviews.Content: This was the most charming hotel I've ever stayed at. I was immediately fond of the old building. The cleanliness of the room, friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, and the gorgeous view of the bay won me over completely. And the price was so reasonable. Would stay there again in a heartbeat. It was also close to Denman, a great street with lots of reasonably priced restaurants and places to rent bicycles. Also close to Stanley Park and its beautiful trails, and lots of access to public transit. Make sure to request a room with a view of the bay! If you're into slick high-end, new and impersonal hotels, this place isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sashazur
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - across the street from the beach at English Bay, a block from Davie and Denman street's nightlife and restaurants, and 2-3 blocks from Stanley Park. Our room had a view of the beach even though it didn't face the beach, and was clean and comfy - though you could tell by the retrofitted bathroom and the oddly shaped hallways that this was originally a residential building, not a hotel. Only real quibble (and it's very minor) is that although there was a TV and phone in the room, there wasn't an alarm clock. Parking (not free) is available in a connected garage, and you can park off the street while you check in. There's a bar/restaurant in the hotel though we didn't try it. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby was always very busy even though we were staying in early October; this clearly is *the* place to stay for a lot of repeat visitors to Vancouver. I know I'll stay here again when I come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ThatNameIsTaken
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sylvia for 4 nights and couldn't have chosen a better location. Staney Park and plenty of places to eat and drink within a few minutes walk. I booked 9 months in advance and got a corner room with a view of English Bay, so we were able to see the sun setting in the evening and watch the joggers/skaters/cyclists before breakfast - with this hotel the view from your room possibly makes a huge difference to how much you enjoy your stay - book early and ask for a Bay view!!! The staff were all very approachable and helpful, without being intrusive. The room was clean, light & airy. Furnishings are basic and the bathroom was functional rather than luxury, but at these prices it would be unrealistic to expect anything else. We would definitely stay at the Sylvia again.

Reviews.Title: “Sylvia 'Hotel'? They're missing an 's'”
Reviews.Author: exmontrealer
Reviews.Content: I just reread some of the postings about this insult of a hotel. I can't believe those guests visited the same hotel I just fled, never mind live on the same planet. I'll cut right to the chase: The Sylvia is a hostel, not a hotel. Rooms are ugly and worn; public areas are dark and grim. Bathrooms, linens, mattresses are prison-grade. It's cynical and contemptuous for the owners of this property to offer these lodgings to guests. I know I sound angry, but it's really that bad. After the first of what was to be a four-night stay here, I literally ran to the Pacific Palisades -- I'm hoping the reliability of a Kimpton property will mitigate the trauma of the Sylvia. I would have checked out immediately if I hadn't prepaid the first night. Unless you're absolutely dead-set on staying near a body of water - the hotel's on English Bay and Stanley Park - head directly to one of the many superior lodging options nearby. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ambience and location”
Reviews.Author: Doctore
Reviews.Content: A family of 3 we spent our first 3 days in Canada at this historic hotel overlooking English Bay and adjacent to Stanley Park. From the dining/bar areas we watched joggers, cyclists, dog walkers, roller bladers etc traverse the tree-lined waterfront promenade. Our bedroom on the 8th floor was enormous and the staff very friendly and helpful - and all for $159 a night. During the rest of our trip embracing Victoria and Seattle we kept meeting people with fond stories of the Sylvia. A must return hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience...”
Reviews.Author: JohnD.Fredricksen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sylvia for five nights. We had no problems with the bookings or the quoted price. The staff was unfailingly helpful. Everyone seemed to genuinely care about us and about helping us have a great Vancouver vacation. Who could beat the price of this hotel? I know of no hotel in Vancouver or any other city in North America that is both a discount hotel and an oceanside property! For a little over a hundred dollars we had ocean side views. Many of Vancouver's hotels, that offer at best a view of the parking lot or the building next door cost two or three times, as much. It is across the street from some of Vancouver's most popular beaches; it is a very short walk to the little sea taxis that will take you to all the must see sights of Vancouver, including the world famous Granville Island Market. It is in walking distance of countless restaurants ranging from the very inexpensive to the expensive. You are no more than a few blocks from Stanley Park and only a short walk to the heart of downtown Vancouver. On the third night of our stay, we had just come back to our room, having enjoyed a very pleasant evening sipping wine and watching the sunset over English Bay, in the beautiful Sylvia Hotel lounge, when we received a call from the hotel desk. They told me that their night watchman had informed them that our rear tire was flat. I went down to check it out and was met by the same night watchman. Noting I was still dressed for the evening, he insisted that I should not change the tire. He changed the tire and even took the time to show us how to get to the nearest tire store. Service above and beyond the expected, for sure! There is no doubt we will becoming back to the Sylva on future Vancouver visits.

Reviews.Title: “No flexibility”
Reviews.Author: TheFranci
Reviews.Content: We had booked a three-night stay at the Sylvia for the end of July for $159 a day. On booking, I had requested a suite, but one was not available, so I requested a bay-side room and they rebooked me for their mid-priced room, but no bay-side guarantee. The problem became evident when we arrived. We had a room on the side away from the bay and the room we were in was in excess of 90 degrees by early in the day and no way to circulate the air. When we asked about a fan, we were told the hotel didn't have any. When we said we would be checking out, one was brought to the room. While it was supposedly unusually hot for Vancouver, a 100-year old hotel should have had sufficient time to find fans.
